text: From high above we see the castle gardens covered in a bl of snow. We hear the tread of footsteps then see a beauti WOMAN in a fur-lined cloak heading towards an unseen obje

Once upon a time, in deep winter, a Queen was admiring the falling snow when she saw a rose blooming in defiance of the cold. The rose looks miraculously red. Nearby, a RAVEN looks on Queen gazes at the flower, then bends down.

Reaching for it, she pricked her finger and three drops of blood fell. BOOM -- with the impact of an artillery shell, a DROP OF lands in the snow. Followed by ANOTHER. And ANOTHER. The Queen startles, then calmly touches her stomach.

And because the red seemed so alive against the white, she thought, if only I had a child as white as snow, lips as red as blood, hair as black as a raven's wings and all with the strength of that rose. A beat, then we hear the piercing cry of a new-born baby

We find ourselves in a crowded chamber full of MIDWIVES a PHYSICIANS. Moving through the chaos we glimpse buckets o water, dirty sponges, astrology charts and protection cha until we see a BABY GIRL in the arms of her happy mother.

Soon after, a daughter was born to the Queen and was named "Snow White." With a radiant smile, the Queen offers SNOW WHITE to her father, KING MAGNUS. The baby's CRIES grow louder as the cradles her gently in his arms, turning towards a mirror.
And she was adored throughout the kingdom as much for her defiant spirit as for her beauty.
A wounded MAGPIE is twitching in a puddle of water. SNOW aged 7 now, steps towards it hesitantly, looking concerne
Pick it up, William. Her companion, William, also 7, braces himself, reaches d then steps back in alarm as the bird starts flapping wild tries to cover his embarrassment by sounding knowledgeabl

It's dying. It doesn't want to be touched. Snow White ignores him, approaching the bird herself. She down, hesitates, then reaches out and strokes the magpie, calming its flapping before she picks it up. High up on a tree, ANOTHER MAGPIE looks on.

SNOW WHITE runs, cupping the wounded bird in her hand, Wi dashing after her. The sun is out and the fields and fore lit up in all their glory. The children sprint through a BEAUTIFUL SEASIDE VILLAGE -- thatched homes with flower g HAPPY FARMERS and FAIR VILLAGE MAIDENS --
Hurry, William! Hurry! They run down the dunes, waves crashing, the sand gleamin the sunlight, until they see the BEAUTIFUL CASTLE up ahea
A single apple tree stands in the middle of the cloisters stands out. Snow White and William dash past it into the

Snow White bursts into her parent's chamber. The King and turn from the window. Two PHYSICIANS are in attendance. S White is too young and preoccupied to notice but her moth smile is tinged with sadness and her father looks heartbr

We found it in the woods. The Queen takes the wounded magpie from Snow White. The K looks on sadly as she pulls a RIBBON from Snow White's ha carefully binds the magpie's wing. William watches from t doorway, noticing how frail the Queen looks. The magpie's flapping gradually calms, its pain easing.
It will heal in time. Snow White's eyes are fixed on the little bird.
I'll look after it. The King watches Snow White, hiding his sorrow behind a s So does the Queen, holding back her tears.
You possess a rare beauty, my love. In here. (She touches Snow white's heart) Never lose it. Hold it dear. You will need its strength to one day become Queen.

Snow White and William, with a small toy bow strapped to back, climb the branches of the apple tree in the cloiste gardens. William picks a DISTINCTIVE RED AND WHITE APPLE offers it to Snow White. He makes a point of the offer, holding it out, nodding. Just as she comes to take it he pulls it away and takes a huge bite himself, grinning. Snow White shoves him off th tree and they fall to the ground. And now we PULL BACK to reveal the King and William's fat DUKE HAMMOND, watching from the throne room balcony.
My daughter will need your son's friendship more than ever, Duke Hammond. As will I yours.
We are here to serve you, your Majesty. As the King watches his daughter, ERIC'S VOICEOVER resume

The next winter was the harshest in memory and Snow White's mother passed away. Ba EXT. GARDENS/ CASTLE - DAY. 8a The garden is covered in snow but there is no red rose no Magnus walks with his arm around Snow white, heartbroken. A single tear rolls down Snow White's cheek. Palace onloo and mourners, fixed on her face, feeling what she feels, aside.
A year went by but the King was inconsolable. Taking advantage of his grief, dark forces gathered on the kingdom's borders. 4

From above we see horses movie through the forest and ent clearing. At the head is -- King Magnus, with Duke Hammond by his side, surrounded by line of the King's Army. They are frozen as they look at- Across the battlefield - Horsemen in a line. THE RIDERS a silhouetted on a misty plain -- a VAST SHADOW ARMY of fac warriors. King Magnus and the Duke trade a look -
From what hell comes this army?

A hell they'll soon revisit! King Magnus SCREAMS A BLOOD CRY, kicks his horse and ride forward with blind courage, no longer caring what happens him. The two lines of warriors race, pell-mell to the center o the battlefield. When they meet -- Hand to hand combat at its most brutal. King Magnus swings his great sword, and a SHADOW WARRIOR SHATTERS LIKE GLASS. All down the line the same is happening - Shadow Warriors shattering, evaporating. Strange. DUKE HAMMOND shatters an opponent as well and as loud and furious as the battlefield was only moments before, it is that quiet. The King and the Duke watch in amazement as the rest of t SHADOW ARMY melts away, DISSOLVING INTO THE MORNING MIST all that is left in the field is --

The unholy army was defeated, leaving King Magnus with the spoils of victory. A CAGED PRISON WAGON. Odd. Not even sure how it got there King Magnus moves toward it, with a little trepidation. W he's close he gets off his horse, walks closer and dares look inside.
Inside the cage, a WOMAN COWERS, her face hidden behind a King Magnus stares at her through the prison bars, then w mighty blow of his sword shatters the lock and enters.
You are now free. You have nothing to fear from me. Duke Hammond watches from outside the cage, a bit wary, a King kneels beside the terrified woman.

What is your name, my lady? Slowly, the woman turns. For a moment the King wonders if his beloved Queen behind the veil. Gently, he lifts her v It's not his wife, but the most beautiful woman he's ever
My name is Ravenna, sire. The King is speechless now, gazing upon the face of an an
So struck by her beauty was the King, that he forgot, for the first time, his broken heart. His gaze is so intense that Ravenna looks down for a mome When she lifts her head --

10a INT. GYPSY WAGON - FLASHBACK - DAY. l0a YOUNG RAVENNA - her face reflected in a small hand mirror Ravenna as a child, beautiful but poor, looks into the mirror. Her MOTHER, a gypsy woman in tattered clothes, mo the mirror closer.

This - is all that can save you, Ravenna. The young Ravenna looks away, distracted by SHOUTS and COMMOTION outside. 10b EXT. GYPSY CAMP - SAME - DAY. 10b A little boy, FINN, runs as fast as he can through the sn toward the Gypsy Camp. Behind him, THE KING'S RIDERS advance on the camp.
Ravenna's mother tries to keep her daughter's attention -
6 10b CONTINUED: 10b
Ravenna!

Present day. Still as a statue and even more beautiful as cheeks are powdered, eyebrows plucked and lips painted by several sets of HANDS. Her eyes stare straight ahead, unblinking, her mind elsewhere. Attendants are preparing Ravenna for her wedding to the K

You're so beautiful... Ravenna snaps to and looks into the face of Snow White, reverential, standing a few feet away. Ravenna's face softens as she looks at the face of Snow White. Ravenna beckons to her with a look and then holds her arm - "Come." As Snow White steps forward, the handmaidens withdraw unt only one is left, weaving beautiful flowers in Ravenna's hair.
That is kind, child. Especially when it is said that yours is the face of true beauty in this kingdom. Snow White doesn't quite know how to answer this.
(A warm smile) Would you like to be dressed up like this and married one day? Snow White nods.
I hope you'll invite me?
Of course. Snow White smiles, enchanted by her new friend.
I know it is difficult, child. When I was your age I, too, lost my mother.
You did?
Yes. A King tore me from her arms, dressed me in lace and stole my innocence. Snow White's smile dies a bit; confused.

I can never take your mother's place, but I feel that you and I are bound. (touches her heart) I feel it here. Snow White mimics, touching her own heart, and smiles at Ravenna. It should be a touching moment but something in Snow White's face - the way her smile lights up the room gives Ravenna pause.

Ravenna, in a stunning dress,.walks down the center aisle the NOBLES in the land are present. Ravenna looks at them, on either side of the aisle. They smiling, nodding appreciation. But they aren't really loo at Ravenna. She follows their gaze to -- Snow White, behind, holding the folds of silk from the wedding dress. Snow White looks up, adoringly, at Ravenna As the bride and groom reach the altar, KING MAGNUS turns smiles, the happiest man alive.

King Magnus lies on the bed, drunk - half with wine and h with lust. His eyes fixed on -- Ravenna, in a sheer silk nightgown standing near the fire holding a goblet. Staring a seductive hole through him. She starts slowly toward him, never taking her eyes off h He licks his lips - can't wait for her to arrive.
(Gazing at her lustfully) Who are you?
The bane of Kings. When she does arrive she slowly crawls onto the bed, roll him on his back, straddles him and offers the goblet.
Sup, my lord. King Magnus drains the goblet, tosses it and gropes her b
Now you are mine. Her eyes gleam in the firelight. Magnus tries to playfull wrestle her off, but she grabs his hands and holds him do firmly.
I will destroy you.
Indeed, you will. She rips open his shirt then bends down and kisses him on lips. He can't believe how good she tastes.
As my people were destroyed. As my family was destroyed. As I would have been destroyed. He is slightly confused by this and his face begins to sh discomfort.
But when a woman stays young forever - no man can resist her - and the world is hers. He suddenly STARTS TO CHOKE, his eyes widening in surpris As he struggles for breath...
What...?

First I will take your life, my lord. Then I will take your throne. She reaches beneath the sheets, pulls out an ORNATE DAGGE and BRINGS IT DOWN THROUGH HIM -- 13a EXT. OUTSIDE ROYAL BEDROOM 13a Several Guards line the hallway. The door opens and Raven emerges. As she moves past them...
The King has laid down his sword for the night. Their eyes take her, lustfully, in as she strides away an disappears around a corner.
9 13b INT. GYPSY WAGON - FLASHBACK - DAY. 13b Ravenna's mother takes Ravenna's hand and holds it over a bowl of white liquid.
You must trust me, my love. With a small blade she nicks Ravenna's wrist. Three drops blood fall into the white liquid - BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! Finn, Ravenna's brother blasts through the door.
They're coming! The King's men!
Drink! Ravenna chokes it down.
Drink! And with it the ability to steal youth and beauty! For that is your ultimate power and only protection. Finn steps forward.
I will protect my sister! Ravenna's mother reaches out and touches her son's forehe closes her eyes, an incantation of sorts...
So it shall be, Finn.

Ravenna exits the castle and crosses the courtyard with a lantern. A portcullis opens and DARK FIGURES emerge from shadows, entering the castle. Leading them is a tall pale warrior (FINN). He looks at Ravenna devotedly.
Welcome, brother.
We see the shadows of the invaders sweeping through the corridors, putting the King's sleeping soldiers to the sw 10
Snow White lies asleep when she hears a bell ringing. At she thinks she's dreaming, but then she hears cries of al She sits up curiously, then climbs out of bed --
There's panic and chaos outside, COURTIERS and SOLDIERS r for their lives. Snow White stares in confusion, then run

Snow White rushes towards her father's chamber and sees R at the end of the corridor. Relieved, she hurries towards stepmother when suddenly she notices her father's lifeles lying on the bed. FINN and his KNIGHTS appear beside Rave takes a moment for the betrayal to sink in, tears of shoc welling in Snow White's eyes, before she turns and flees

The chaos has spread to the courtyard, DUKE HAMMOND'S KNI struggling to hold back the invaders. Snow White hurries dazed by the sight of battle, then sees William pull free father's guards and run towards her -- William grabs her protectively when strong arms reach dow lift them both onto the back of separate horses. Duke Ham and his personal guard are attempting to ride out of the before the portcullis closes. The Duke rides under the portcullis with William. His bod is about to follow when an ARROW FROM FINN STRIKES HIM IN BACK and both he and Snow White are thrown off their hors
Father! The Princess! But the portcullis is down, separating Snow White and Wil The last thing he sees is Snow White struggling in Finn's being hauled back into the castle.

Ravenna walks from statue to painting to urn, toppling an tearing them from the walls. Cleaning house. Ravenna's so deliver a large object, then leaving her alone. A BEAUTIF MIRROR rests against the wall. Ravenna stares at it.

Mirror, mirror, on the wall Who is the fairest of them all? There'.s a brief silence, then the surface of the mirror LIQUID-spills onto the floor where it reforms into the sh THE MIRROR MAN. His body is a veil of reflective bronze b face-is a distorted version of Ravenna's own.

it is you, my Queen! Yet another kingdom falls to your glory! Is there no end to your power and beauty? Ravenna smiles, moves to the center of the room, raises h and drunk with power -- SCREAMS! The scream becomes --

20a EXT. GYPSY WAGON - FLASHBACK - DAY. 20a Young Ravenna's SCREAM as she is ripped from her mother's arms. Finn throws himself into the mix but is backhanded the ground. Ravenna's mother moves forward, ready to atta The Guard holding Ravenna pulls a dagger and puts it to Ravenna's throat, which stops her mother. Ravenna is dragged away and tossed on the back of a horse

But be warned Ravenna: By fairest blood it is done and only by fairest blood can it be undone. Ravenna looks back to see her mother and other gypsies pu the sword. Finn struggles free and chases after the King's men as th gallop away.
20b EXT. COURTYARD - NIGHT. 20b All the wedding guests and nobles stand, held there by gu with swords and daggers. Ravenna stands at the top of the stairs.
So kind of you all to stay over.
What shall we do with these? She eyes the noblemen and guests from left to right. Thei eyes beg for mercy. There is none.
To the sword.
12 20b CONTINUED: 20b There are GASPS and SCREAMS as the Guards move the guests away. Ravenna notices Finn, off to one side, his dagger at the of Snow White, who stares defiantly at Ravenna.
Finn! Finn stops his exit with Snow White, and turns. Ravenna stares at the little girl, not sure where she stands with this one. And then,...
Lock her away. One never knows when royal blood may be of value.

head_text.subj: OVER A TIME-LAPSE IMAGE OFA ROTTING RED AND WHITE APPL

text: The spell Ravenna's mother placed on her gave her the ability to steal youth and beauty, and indeed all things good, for her own evil purposes. But for every life there must be a death, for every gain, loss, and under the reign of Ravenna nature turned on itself and people turned on each other.

And all this time, she kept Snow White in a cell in the north tower. Ravenna, in the shadows, sits perfectly still. Though it' been years she looks the same. The object of her gaze is Snow White, who has changed. She is now a woman, lying in darkened cell. Asleep. Around the corner, Finn secretly eyes his sister, who doe notice him. Ravenna, just outside the cell, doesn't blink, entranced Snow White. Strange. Snow White opens her eyes and sees Ravenna. This is not t first time this has happened. Their eyes locked. Then...
Why?... Ravenna doesn't answer, just stands and walks away.
A chill wind whips through the woods. Lying sprawled on t ground we see a man (ERIC) who looks like he's dead.
It's only as we move closer to his rugged face that we se empty FLAGON OF GROG by his side and realize he's drunk. eyes flicker, as a WOMAN'S SCREAM cuts through the woods.
SARA, beautiful, in pain. A patch of blood blossoms on he dress. Her mouth is open, screaming but no sound comes ou
Eric's eyes flicker and begin to open -- then he hears it again.
Help!!!! He rises to his feet unsteadily, his head pounding from a hangover, then grabs two THROWING HATCHETS and slides the his harness on his back --
Eric runs past trees and ducks under branches, crashing i few, still drunk. As he arrives at a clearing he sees a beautiful girl, (ROSE), fighting off a HUGE TATTOOED WARR (BROCH).
Lay a hand on her and I'll take your head! BROCH turns and sees the huntsman with his hatchet raised
Ale given you courage again, huntsman?
Won't take much courage to split your skull from here.

Aye, but first you'd have to see straight. Broch advances with a grin, drawing his own axe. Trying t his vision and steady his aim, Eric hurls the hatchet -- MISSES, the blade sticking in the tree above the frighten Greta's head -- Broch is on Eric in an instant, swinging his huge battle Eric narrowly avoids the deadly blows, his natural skill dexterity slowed down by all the ale he's drunk.

Rose looks on, terrified, as Broch drives Eric towards th trees. He corners him against an oak and swings his axe - for Eric to duck at the last moment -- The blade buries itself deep in the tree, stuck. We reali from Eric's dark smile that he lured Broch into the trap. draws his second hatchet, but instead of using the blade, Broch over the head with the handle, knocking him out. Rose looks on in admiration as the huntsman goes through pockets.

Thank you. Eric turns. Rose sees how handsome he is. Eric stares at thoughtfully then approaches and gently lifts her chin, examining her pretty features. Rose doesn't seem to mind, looking back with an inviting smile.
I don't know how to repay you? Eric stares at her a moment, then suddenly picks her up a tosses her over his shoulders.
Don't worry, somebody else will.

And now we see a RICKETY PRISON WAGON full of BEAUTIFUL G just like Rose, staring out furiously from behind bars. E a SLAVE MERCHANT haggle over Rose who is bound and gagged looking just as furious as the other women.
Her nose is on the large size and her chin's a little weak.
Your eyes are dim.
I'll give you two gold pieces.
After all the business we've done together? Rose curses behind her gag as Eric pulls her away.
Four gold pieces and that's my final offer! Eric doesn't even bother to turn around.
I'll peddle my wares elsewhere, thank you. The slave merchant sees his prize disappearing and calls
Ten gold pieces! Eric hesitates, but it's not from a guilty conscience, he considering the price. Then he smiles, turns. They have a
We get our first good look at grown Snow White as she sha wood for a fire. She's done this every day for years. A regimen. Her hands work precisely as she stacks the wood blows on the kindling.
15 29a OMITTED 29a

The fire is now burning and Snow White warms her hands on She hears APPROACHING FOOTSTEPS. Unusual. She jumps up ge in her bed and pretends to sleep. A GUARD opens a cell opposite Snow White. A few seconds later the door CLANGS SHUT. As soon as the Guard is gone, Snow White rises, walks to cell door and looks down the hall to the other cell.
Hello?... What's your name? Rose, sitting in a dark corner, goes to her cell bars and looks out.
I am Rose. Snow White smiles - a friendly face.

Ravenna stands, attended by MAIDS, in a black gown, open front. Appropriate in private but not when -- Ravenna's GENERALS and Finn stand across from her. The Generals avert their eyes, made uncomfortable by her near nakedness. The General uses a pointer to make his presentation while another holds a map.
There are scattered rebel groups on the fringe of the dark forest, but they cause little harm.
She dips her fingers into a bowl of DEAD SONGBIRDS, pluck out a tiny heart and eats it as she listens, not happy.
And what of the Duke?
We have pushed his forces into the mountains but his stronghold at Carmath  holds firm.
Lay siege to it.
The mountains and fortress provide impenetrable protection, my Queen.
Then lure him out! Burn every village that supports him. Poison their wells. If they still resist put their heads on pikes to decorate the roads!
My Queen. (chooses words carefully) They have taken the fight to us. Rebels harry our supply lines and rob our pay wagons.
We have just captured two of the rebel leaders. They will be put to the sword.

I wish to interrogate them myself. She drops her robe and walks up the steps to her bath. Sh lowers herself into the white liquid. Her face disappears beneath the viscous liquid, then she rises, like a porcel statue. 17 31a INT. BATHING CHAMBER - MOMENTS LATER 31a ECU - A small songbird, it's chest open, revealing a smal heart. Ravenna's claw plucks the tiny heart and we follow to her mouth. She is dressed now and stands at a window, Finn at her si OUTSIDE THE WINDOW - A CROWD OF STARVING PEASANTS at the of the castle, fight over the milk pouring from her bath.
I won't go back. She is lost for a moment, then...
Finn, do you remember when we were children, begging for scraps like those wretches?
Yes, my Queen.
Am I not kinder?
Rose and Snow White converse...
All the girls in our village were taken. I was trying to reach safe haven at Duke Hammond's castle when I was caught -- Snow White bursts with hope --
The Duke?! He's alive?! He still fights in my father's name?! Rose stares at the feral girl now, realizing who she is.
You're the king's daughter? Princess?... The night the evil one's reign began we were told all in the castle were put to the sword. How were you spared?
William? What about William?! The Duke's son?! Is he alive?!
I don't know, princess. Rose shakes her head, still gazing at Snow White, then he the distant cries of other female prisoners.
What will they do to me? 18

Ravenna sweeps into the great hall. The Generals and Finn snap to attention. She stops and st at TWO MEN, the captured insurgents. THOMAS, a grizzled old rebel, looks badly bruised and bea while his handsome son, LAIN, is unmarked. They both star her defiantly. Ravenna faces the two rebels. A SOLDIER steps forward.
My Queen, these two were captured leading an ambush of our supply caravan. Ravenna seems intrigued, steps forward, eyeing them.
You left your home, your family, the bosom of my protection, to aid my enemies? Why?
Because under your rule we have lost everything. We will not stop until this kingdom is free.
Lost everything?
Your son? She moves to Iain, right up to his face.
Very handsome.
Obviously a debt owed to your wife. She reaches out and touches Iain's strong jaw. He struggl against the Guards that hold him back.

There was a time I would have lost my heart to a face like yours -- and you would have no doubt broken mine. In a flash Iain grabs a Guard's dagger and rams it into Ravenna's chest. She makes a pained face, looks down at t dagger, then up to Iain.
You would kill your Queen? She pulls the dagger out - there is no"wound, no blood - drops it on the ground. Iain and Thomas are shocked.

(admiring; to Iain) You have beauty. And courage. But how strong is your heart? She smiles, almost regrettably, then places her hand on h chest. We hear HIS HEART START TO HAMMER -- LOUDER AND LO He grimaces in pain as she SQUEEZES -- the hammering fill ears -- until his heart finally bursts and he drops dead. Thomas falls to his knees in horror, trying to revive his Finn draws his sword to behead him when Ravenna raises he
No. Let him return to the Duke and speak of the generosity of his Queen. With that she sweeps out, followed by Finn. It's only now we see the lines on her face. Finn takes her by the arm a falters.
Are you alright? Ravenna pulls her arm away furiously. The General and the others stare, alarmed.
They quickly exit, all save Finn, who watches, concerned, Ravenna leans against the wall for support. She pulls herself together, looks at Finn.
Magic comes at a lofty price.
And the expense grows.
You look...
old?...
Tired.

My powers... fade. This is about as much as Ravenna can confess. Finn watche as she walks up the stairs to the mirror chamber. Then he turns and CLAPS HIS HANDS TWICE. A GUARD appears and Finn nods. 20 33a INT. MIRROR CHAMBER - ROYAL PALACE 33a Ravenna walks into the room. Eyes the mirror, afraid to l at herself.

I have something for what ails you. She turns to see -- Finn, with Rose. Ravenna almost smiles. Rose holds her gaze defiantly. Ravenna walks over, admire her face, smiles, then takes her by the throat and -- LIFTS HER OFF HER FEET. Rose opens her mouth to scream bu instead of sound, ENERGY pours out. Ravenna opens her mou DEVOURING GRETA'S YOUTH AND BEAUTY. Like a flower bloomin her lines vanish. Like a flower wilting, Rose AGES until she's as old as the scullery maids.
Snow White hears approaching footsteps and watches as a G opens Greta's cell and tosses someone in.
Rose?... The Guard clangs the cell door shut and walks away. Snow White peers through the shadows. Can't quite make he out.
Rose?...
RAVENNA stares into her mirror now, rejuvenated.
Mirror, mirror, on the wall, Who is the fairest of them all? The bronze ripples. The Mirror Man pours out and reforms.
My Queen, you have defied nature and robbed it of its fairest fruit. But on this day there is one more beautiful than you.
More beautiful, but --
She is the reason your powers wane.
She won't live to see tomorrow. Who is it?! Give me her name?!
Snow White. Ravenna is shocked by this, staggers a bit.
Snow White?
Finn'.'. (back to mirror) I should have killed her as a child. She is my undoing?

She is also your treasure, Queen. It was wise to have kept her close for the innocence and purity that can destroy can also heal. Hold her heart in your hands and you shall never again need to consume youth. You shall never again weaken or age. Immortality without cost! Ravenna laughs, overjoyed. Finn appears out of the shadows. All he sees is his siste laughing, giddily into her mirror, no sign of the mirror as if it exists only in her head.
Yes, Queen?...

Snow White paces in her cell, frantic. Two magpies appear in the window. She looks at them and watches as they flap their wings. Like they're trying to tell her something. She moves toward them. They jump back and up to the edge of the roof that is bes the cell window, hovering there. She is confused but notices -- A roofing nail, right where the Magpies hover. Snow White reaches a hand out the window and touches the loose nail. Her fingers move it back and forth as it, bit bit, breaks free. She yanks hard.at the nail, almost has it when -- The Magpies flutter again and blast away, as if afraid --

Snow White hears FOOTSTEPS down the hall. She steadies herself, yanks once, twice and the nail come loose. she jumps down, lies in her bed again just as -- Finn unlocks her door, leaving the key in the lock, and w into the cell. He stands there until she turns her head slightly to him. She doesn't move, grips the nail in her closed hand as sh tries to lure him closer with her eyes.
Did I wake you? Snow White shakes her head gently.
Are you always awake when I watch you?
Yes. She looks away.
You've never come in before.
My Queen won't allow it. She wants you all to herself.
I'm afraid of her.
Not of me.
No. He can't help himself, reaches out and touches her arm.
It's alright, princess. You will never again be locked in a cell.
What does she want from me? His finger move from her hair to her cheek, stroking it gently, and then to her chest. With his free hand he reac back for his dagger.

Your beating heart. Snow White grips the roofing nail even tighter as she loo at him. As he leans closer, she notices his off hand - th dagger and -- She SLASHES him across the face with the nail. Blood flie Finn reacts, grabs his face in pain, yells and Snow White kicks him and runs for the door, locking it behind -- 23

Snow White hurtles down the steps to Greta's cell. She is shocked by what she sees. Rose, now an old woman, looks t Snow White fumbles with the keys. Rose holds out both her hands. Snow White takes them, looks into her eyes.
Go. Finn stumbles to the cell door, clutching his face.
Snow White tosses the keys into an empty cell and races a
Snow White runs down the steps into a corridor and sees A GUARDS appear at the other end. She hurries into another bolting the door shut behind her, and charges down the st

SNOW WHITE BURSTS OUTSIDE -- into the light. She almost hyperventilates at all the air, the sky. Then she runs th the courtyard toward the portcullis. The magpies fly right into her face then away, telling he follow. She does and heads straight for the small opening the base of the castle wall - the entrance to the SEWERS. As the magpies rise, she slides on one hip, plunging into darkness below. The guards follow but can't squeeze throu the opening, running towards the Portcullis instead.
Snow White splashes through the deep stinking sludge.
The old rebel, Thomas, with his son's body draped over a looks back curiously as he hears the guards yelling --
Open the gates! The Princess has escaped! He stares in surprise as riders gallop out.
Snow White is swept out of the sewers into the sea. Seawe wraps itself around her limbs, pulling her deeper.into th depths, but she kicks and fights her way back to the surf gasping for air. 24

Snow White swims ashore. She looks up and sees a maze of rocks stretching out. She sets off in one direction when MAGPIES reappear, urging her to follow them in another direction. She scrambles after them and sees a WHITE MARE waiting for her on the beach, lying on its side, allowing climb on. The mare raises itself and is away in a flash.
Galloping hooves skim the surf, RIDERS pursuing Snow Whit

Snow White rides towards the village -- only it's unrecog now -- most of the cottages have been razed to the ground boarded up. A group of people including children - skeletal, hungry, desperate - see her approach and move out to greet her. She stops her horse for a moment, gazing past tears at th devastation and the state of villagers all around her. At first their approach seems harmless but as they get cl their faces reveal dangerous desperation and -- She gallops off, looking back to see the Queen's men givi chase.

location: FIELDS AND WOODLAND BEYOND THE VILLAGE

text: The fields and woods are even more devastated than the vi Farmland has been burnt to cinders and trees chopped down around Snow White the world is stubble and ash.

Snow White crests a hill, her mare rearing as she sees -- DARK FOREST -- A VAST WALL OF PRIMORDIAL TREES. A mist se from the forest like an evil miasma. Snow white hesitates then sees the riders closing in and urges her mare on --

location: MISTY BOGS/ ENTRANCE TO THE DARK FOREST

text: Shadows everywhere. The mare charges into the misty bog t suddenly loses her footing. She rears -- throwing Snow Wh onto the safety of solid ground. Snow White tries to grab her reins but the horse pulls aw wanting to endanger her life. She tries again but the hor backs farther away from her. Slowly they're separated by swirling fog -- As Snow White sees the silhouettes of the riders reappear Reluctantly she turns and runs into the forest --

The riders are about to follow when their horses rear and in terror. One guard is thrown off and sucked down in the frightening off the others. Despite their concern for Snow White, the MAGPIES are als afraid to enter the forest.

Snow White hurtles through the trees, a ghostly fog risin all around her, then trips over a root, landing face firs A patch of LARGE MUSHROOMS that unleash CLOUDS OF POLLEN. coughs, trying to fan the pollen away, but it's too late. hurries on, but the hallucinations come thick and fast no The trees look almost human, hooded figures peering at he through the haze. She sees owls without eyes. Black oil o out of tree trunks. A hanging vine reaches down and touch like a hand and now she runs -- More terrors rage at her from the swirling mist. She stum again and when she looks up vampire bats scream at her fr trees. Huge skeletal forms crack out of the bark, descend her until she finally passes out.
From high above, we see the unconscious Snow White as mis whirls in a circle. 52a EXT. CASTLE BEACH - NIGHT.(D4N) 52a Vicious waves crash into rocks. Nature's anger on display
From above we see Ravenna striding furiously in a circle her own. She is livid, a whirling dervish. She's fairly spitting as she barks at Finn, who stands in middle of the room, his face bleeding.

How is it an innocent young girl makes a fool of my brother?! Armed only with a nail?! If she'd had a sword she'd have taken the whole castle! We're in front of her, behind her, on her face, on her fe She picks up the pace as well as the volume --
You swore to protect me! Do you not understand what, the girl means to us?! This is my future! This is everything. Everything! (MORE)az
There is no one I can trust in this place!! There is no loyalty! None!!!!
And then she stops on a dime, turns to him, marches right Finn and -- BELTS HIM! Hard. He staggers a bit then picks himself up, looks at her.
She was chased into the dark forest. She's likely already dead. She SCREAMS and slaps him viciously.
She's no good to me there, lost. I must have her heart! You have failed me! Finn's had enough, he erupts at her --
Have I not given all to you?! She takes this, softens, unexpectedly, and almost smiles.
Have I not given you all? All. She raises her finger and touches his face. His wound hea instantly and his face grows calm. He nods.
Indeed, my Queen.
Don't fail me again, Finn.
I have no powers in the Dark Forest. Bring me someone who knows it well. Someone who can hunt her!
53a OMITTED 53a
Finn speaks to a group of people assembled by his men.
The Queen demands the services of someone to navigate the Dark Forest. The villagers stay mum, shaking their heads.
No-one goes into the Dark Forest.
You will be compensated. Still no takers. An OLD-TIMER stares right at FINN, steps forwards.
There's one man. A widower.
Where might I find him.
In the Inn. Drinking. THE SOUND OF SMASHING WOOD. They turn to see -- Eric flies through the Inn's wall and lands in a heap on ground.
Appears he's finished.
Eric. Drunk. He tries to focus as Broch strides through t same hole and stands over him.
You owe me money from my pocket and money for the girl!

I have it right here in my pocket. If you'll just help me up. Eric holds his hand out. Broch walks over, suspicious. Wh he's close, Eric grabs his arm and kicks with both feet i Broch's chest. Broch flies back, then strides to Eric and kicks him in the side. Hurts.
I want my money!

Actually, I seem to have drunk it all. You're welcome to it when it comes out again. Broch hauls him back up to his feet. He takes a swing but somehow the drunken Eric dodges the blow, swinging back a him. Everyone has come out of the Inn to enjoy the fight. Eric lands a body blow to Broch, who doubles over. Eric comes in for the kill, winds up and swings - Missing Broch but hitting a HORSE on the ass. It kicks it legs, sending him flying. He lands in a heap and drops hi head back. Hands lift him and -- Drop him in a horse trough. He's underwater for a few seconds before he comes to and lifts out his head, eyes s closed.
Perfume? He opens his eyes to see Finn gazing down at him.
Royalty. That explains it.
The Queen demands your presence.
Can't you see I'm having a bath?

RAVENS perch on the ledges and LURCHERS scamper about. Eric, still drunk, filthy, damp clothes, face bruised, en the room, eyes the ravens, then looks at -- Ravenna on her throne. She watches him curiously. He's mo interested in the aged scullery maids, including Rose, wh staring at him accusingly. He has no idea who they are or he's done wrong. Finally he comes before the Queen, sizin up like a tavern beauty.
My brother tells me you are a widower, a drunkard and one of few who has ventured into the dark forest. Finn looks on, standing nearby.
One of my prisoners has escaped there.
Then he's dead -
She. She shoots Finn a pointed look then looks back at Eric.
Then she is certainly dead.
Find her. Bring her to me. Eric holds her gaze, uneasy at the request.
I've been to the Dark Forest enough times to know I'm not going back.
You will be rewarded handsomely.
Coin's no good to me if I'm lying dead with crows picking at my eyes. Ravenna steps off her throne now, approaching him.
There may be more than gold in the offing.
Why is her life of such value?
That is none of your concern.
I'll determine what concerns me, thank you. She smiles, moves even closer to him.
You will do this for me, Huntsman.
And if I refuse? Ravenna nods to the Guards, who pull their swords. Dying cut him to pieces. Eric eyes them, then looks to her and, complete honesty --
Do me the favor. I beg of you.
So you wish to be reunited with your beloved? Eric reacts instinctively, grabbing her by the throat. Th courtiers rise to their feet and the guards draw their swords, but Ravenna holds up her hand.
My wife is none of your concern. Something about her face, the fact that she enjoys his ha on her throat makes Eric queasy. He releases his grip, stares right at Ravenna.
My condolences. Ravenna holds his gaze.
You miss her? His eyes say, yes, he misses her horribly.
What would you give to bring her back? Eric stares at her curiously.
You know of my powers. Bring me the girl and I will bring back your wife.
Nothing will bring her back. Ravenna moves even closer, looks him right in the eye. Sh is incredibly persuasive as she says --
I can. Believe me, huntsman. Eric's eyes say he wants to believe. Needs to believe.
A life for a life.
Mist drifts across the moors, the primordial trees loomin ahead. Finn and Eric ride side by side, FOUR GUARDS follo
You fought in the west? Against the armies of the five kings? Eric nods without looking at him, gazing at the forest.
You must have seen a great deal of death?
Death is everywhere.
Come now, you're being modest. There is a difference between gutting a deer and gutting a man. How many did you kill?
It's not something I counted.
(with a smile) Nor I. But I recall every face. There is no greater delight than battle. Eric finds this unseemly, but prefers not to engage.
Come now, huntsman, what do you feel when you watch a man die? Delight? Invincibility?
Sorrow. This takes Finn aback, not an answer he was expecting. Af a beat...
And what of them? At the tip of your sword. What do they feel? I'd enjoy knowing. Eric looks at him, realizing from Finn's face that it is honest question. -
The.only difference between you and I is I'-never found a wife to save my soul.
Too bad. You'll need one. He stops his horse and nods.
They are all stopped at the entrance to the Dark Forest f meters ahead. The Guards gulp back their fears. Finn trie to hide his own. Even the horses sense danger and start to whinny and back

Vines and roots have grown over Snow White's body, as if forest is trying to devour her. She opens her eyes, sees wrists and ankles bound and reacts in horror, struggling herself of her bonds. WE PULL UP, UP, UP until we can see the full scope of the Dark Forest.
Eric and Finn have tethered their nervous horses and stan the entrance to the bog.

Do exactly as I do. Eric carefully places one foot after the next on grassy s stones that disappear into the bog as soon as his full we on them. The others catch on and follow, stepping on ston their own. Once they're across the bog and onto dry land Finn takes step forward but Eric grabs his arm.

Exactly as I do. Eric puts a cloth to his face, gesturing for Finn and his to do the same and moves forward through the mushroom fie pops of pollen misting all around them. Eric stops, bends down, spotting faint FOOTPRINTS in the walks faster now, Finn watching in admiration.

Snow White finally shakes free of the vines, jumps up and she's being followed. She looks up at the trees but all s are vague shadows. The wind picks up, ghostly voices howl the breeze. She's rooted to the spot for a moment, then l her nerve and runs -- 64aEXT. DARK FOREST - DAY. 64a Eric, Finn and the Guards move through a dark copse of tr VOICES AND WHISPERS-call to them from the wind. Eric stop looks around.
32 64a CONTINUED: 64a

Pay them no mind. One of the Guards leans over a pool of water to drink whe sees a GHOSTLY REFLECTION gazing back at him. He stares i surprise, leaning closer. Suddenly a BARBED TAIL shoots o of the water -- skewering him -- and drags him into the depths. The others turn as they hear a scream but there's no sign their companion now, just the bubbling water. Only Finn looks unconcerned. Eric stops senses something, holds up a hand. Then darts ahead, leaving them flat-footed. Finn makes a decision to follow and waves for his Guards to go ahead o him. They reluctantly follow Eric.
Eric moves quickly then stops, listens - we see his hunti skills - as he hears the noise of cracking branches in th distance, he blasts away, moving like lightning.

Snow White feels like the whole forest is pursuing her. R out of breath, she hides in some bushes. As she stares in mist, she sees a sinister figure appear through the haze. Eric stops and looks around, sensing his prey is close. S White stays low, trying to quieten her breathing. Eric studies the forest floor. He sees Snow White's footp then looks up at an area of disturbed undergrowth. Snow White peers through the bushes and sees the huntsman boots approaching. She looks around for something to defe herself with when the sound of the footsteps fades. She c see anyone now. She looks relieved when SUDDENLY STRONG H GRAB HER BY THE FEET AND DRAG HER OUT OF THE BUSHES. She fights to get away but he pins her with a foot, reach down and turns her over. His first look at her gives him pause. Her face, her spir her youth. She slaps at him - he pulls out his knife with one hand while he pins her with the other. Then grabs, lifts her.
Let me go!
She bites him. He grimaces and grabs her tighter and star trudging back.
She's going to kill me! The Oueen! He ignores, keeps moving.
Sure she is.
Believe me! Her brother tried to cut out my heart. He stops, looks at her.
I swear it. He somehow believes her. New game. Then...
Quick work! Eric looks up to see Finn and his men approaching. Snow W gasps at the sight of Finn.
Him! He's the one! He came at me with a knife! Eric holds her tight, one arm around her neck.
Well done, huntsman. Hand her over.
You can't trust him!
What do you intend to do with her?
Why do you care? Finn nods and the Guards approach. Eric grips her tighter
You want her. Give me what I was promised.
Come now huntsman, you did your job well. Keep your word and hand her over.
He'll betray you -
Shut up! -
He'll kill us both -
I said, shut up! He puts his knife to her throat to quiet her.
I'll keep my word when the Queen keeps hers. Finn shakes his head and laughs.
You are a drunk and a fool. My Queen has many powers; she can take life or sustain it. But she can't bring your wife back from the dead.

His face tells us how much Eric wanted, needed to believe The Guards keep inching toward Eric. Eric, still with a knife to Snow White's throat, starts slowly backing up. Finn pulls his own sword and approaches. Four against one. As they burst toward him he tosses Snow White to the ground and in the same motion throws his kni into the chest of one of the Guards, who crumbles. Eric reaches behind, grabs both hatchets and faces off wi the others. They all rush at once. Eric fights off the guards as he raises a hatchet, throws it -- Right into Finn's chest. Just like Ravenna, no blood, no wound. Finn pulls it out, laughs and throws it at the huntsman who ducks as it sticks into a tree. Snow White, terrified, races off into the forest. They notice her exit but keep fighting. Eric fights on three sides now - holding his own until Fi manages to plunge a sword in his side.

Eric grunts and falls back. Finn races forward to finish off but Eric lunges and -- Flips Finn onto his back and into a grove of mushrooms. Eric covers his nose with his arm and looks at the other Guards, who look from Finn, who is dazed, to Eric, who is hurt. Finn struggles to his knees, shakes his head, hallucinati bit.

Butcher him! Find her! The Guards, also trying to cover their noses, move forwar Eric has a decision to make. Bad odds. And he's injured. Eric decides in an instant, grabs his knife out of the dead Guard, as well as his hat from the tree and runs after Snow White --

Snow White crashes through the woods. Then a HAND grabs her shoulder-- Eric. He slaps a palm over her mouth before she can screa and slides down a steep slope into undergrowth. 67a EXT. DARK FOREST - FINN - SAME 67a Finn is on his feet but still hallucinating - stumbling about. The Guards are spooked as they look all around.

This is not finished! The words echo through the dark forest. 67b EXT. DARK FOREST - ERIC AND SNOW WHITE - SAME 67b Eric removes his hand from Snow White's mouth. At once she PUNCHES HIM WITH ALL SHE'S GOT. He steps back, licks his bloody lip. She takes another sw This one he manages to grab.
Get your hands off me. She draws his dagger. He backs off. Eyeball to eyeball:
36 67b CONTINUED: 67b
Get away.
Who are you? What the hell's going on?
Get away from me.
Why does the Queen want you dead?
She wants us all dead. All of us-
Then what makes you so damn valuable?
You should know. You're the one hunting me. He backs away. Paces.
67b CONTINUED: (2) 67b
Never get involved in the Queen's business and what do I do? Get involved in the Queen's business... Without warning, he walks off. Leaving her alone. She follows him.
Where are you going?
Away from you, love. You're trouble.
I need to get to the Duke's Castle. There's an army there. I'll be safe.
The Duke? I've seen sheep with more fight in them. Desperate, she takes a chance.
Take me, you'll be rewarded. I'm valuable. Isn't that why you're here?
You're dead if you return without me. And I'm dead if you leave me. He turns, exasperated with her.
(Then -- wearily:) Just for argument's sake. (Shakes his head) How much?
How much is enough? Eric "reluctantly" prices up the job.
Well,it's a long way, through the forest, and that... that's a dangerous road, I couldn't even consider it for less than thirty gold pieces...
A hundred. Deliver me safe to the Duke. I give you my word.
67b CONTINUED: (3) 67b Deep quandary. Still suspicious..
Who are you? She looks at him levelly.
Maybe that's a question you should have asked the queen. Stand-off.
Do we have a deal?
I don't trust you Billy Goat.
I've given you my word. He spits on his hand. She puts out her hand. He shakes it.
I still don't trust you.
I don't trust you either. She wipes it on her skirt. Behind them, a commotion. They run off.
67c OMITTED 67c

68a EXT. DARK FOREST - DAY. 68a Tree roots gleam with an eerie phosphorescent light. The closes in. Snow White looks around the forest, unnerved b the haunting silence and the deep shadows. Reluctantly sh focuses on Eric, trying to take her mind off the terrors around her. He sits on a log for a breath.
We'll stay the night here.
You haven't answered me.
I don't recall a question.
Where are we going? He takes a stick, draws in the dirt.
Queen. Mountains. Dark Forest. Here. Past. There's a village. She takes the stick, points to a different spot in the di
I'm going to the Duke's Castle. He grabs the stick back.
You'll go where I take you.
You'll take me to the Duke's castle or I'll go alone.
68a CONTINUED: 68a SNOW WHITE (cont'd) (beat; looks around) As soon as you get me out of the forest.
You're rather demanding, and not all that endearing, you know?
38 68a CONTINUED: (2) 68a
There's a reward that awaits you. There are noblemen there, an army.
An army? The Duke fights? He hides behind walls. I know sheep that have more fight in them. (after a beat) How much? (off her look) Reward? Just for argument's sake?
How much do you want? Eric considers this, not sure how or if to negotiate.
Two hundred gold pieces. Do we have a deal? More, a lot more, than he was expecting.
I'll deliver you to safety m' lady.
Swear it.
I swear (beat). Constantly. It's one of my better qualities. She's not sure what to make of this, but...

Fine. He moves to a spot to lie down and gathers leaves. Snow White seeks her own spot and comes upon -- the RIB C OF A DEAD DEER, a host of BEAUTIFUL BUTTERFLIES feeding o its bones. She is shocked. Eric notices...
I've seen far stranger things in here. She sits, looks to Eric. Something's been bothering her.
Do you think... will they follow us?
They'd be foolish to. Few survive. Good news/bad news. She looks around.
39 68a CONTINUED: (3) 68a
How far have you travelled into the Dark Forest?
We passed it a few miles back. He opens his flask and takes a healthy pull.
We're moving over high mountains and valleys now, approac Duke Hammond's castle.
Grim faced COMMANDERS look on as DUKE HAMMOND comforts a sobbing man in the firelight. We recognise the old rebel, THOMAS, whose son was killed by Ravenna.
She killed brave Lain with only her palm and pulled a dagger from her chest without blood. She cannot be killed. Duke Hammond has heard enough, turns to leave.
There is more.
The princess has escaped the castle!
Where is my son?

FLAMING MOSS is thrown into a puddle of oil and a MASSIVE FIRE lights up the night. William, rapid-fires his bow at close quarters into a lin the Queen's supply wagons and the fight is on. A VIOLENT CLASH OF SWORDS IN CLOSE QUARTER FIGHTING. His COMPANIONS are as wild and hot-headed as he is, roari with delight as the Queen's men finally flee.
73a INT. WAR ROOM/ DUKE HAMMOND'S CASTLE - NIGHT. 73a William enters.
You asked for me, father?
40 73a CONTINUED: 73a
I have news of the Princess. William stares in surprise --
The Princess?!!
Ravenna has kept her all these years.
She lives?!
She escaped the castle and into the dark
He turns to leave --
I'm going after her!.
We don't know if she survived -- Duke Hammond grabs him by the arm.
You ventured beyond the walls tonight, disobeying my orders. We are all that's left, William. I cannot afford to lose any more of my men.
Then I will go alone.
And I cannot afford to lose my only heir! You do not know the dark forest!
Then I'll find someone who does. William pulls away.
I will not abandon her a second time.
William gallops away from the castle walls under the cove the breaking dawn. 75 MOVED TO 68a 75 41
A motley crew of woodsmen stand side to side. Finn is eye them, sizing them up, picking a crew.
Which of you knows the dark forest? A powerfully built Yakut tracker, ALDAN, and BROCH both n
You. You. You. You. He's selected Aldan, Broch and points to others. As we mo down the line we see -- William, hat low, trying to look tough. Finn selects a few more.
Load and prepare. You ride for bounty. Into the dark forest. The rest of you. Away ! As they disperse.. William sets his jaw, and heads off..
The men ride out of the village. Suddenly they stop. Standing up ahead is William, blocking their path. He cal to them.
You need a bowman? FINN calls back.
I have a bowman. Away. WILLIAM stands unblinking.
I said away, damn you! WILLIAM doesn't move. Finn turns to the bowman.
Kill him.
The bowman smiles, draws his bow. BEFORE he can loose an arrow:
Two arrows strike the bowman in the throat, lifting him o his horse, stone dead. FINN turns. WILLIAM lowers his bow.
I said do you need a bowman? Finn studies William with dead eyes.
80aEXT. VILLAGE ROAD - DAY. 80a In the pouring rain, a group of fierce BOUNTY HUNTERS rid horseback, when another rider appears, blocking their way It's William.
43 80a CONTINUED: 80a

Clear the road. But William doesn't budge. One of the other mercenaries grins, then rides towards William, drawing his sword. He raises it when William unslings his bow and loosens two arrows at close range, hitting him in each thigh and knocking him off his horse. Broch draws his enormous battle axe, about to charge, whe Finn rides forward and stops him.
Wait! Finn sizes up William.
You're quick with a bow.
I want to ride with you.
Why?
You are paying well and I need the coin.
Have you traversed the Dark Forest?
No.
Then what use are you?
As you said, I'm quick with a bow. He nods to the guy on the ground, groaning with arrows in thighs.
And unlike him, I have two good legs. Finn considers for a moment, then smiles, nods to the guy the ground.
Replace him. William looks at Finn gratefully. Finn studies him with a curious smile then rides on. 44
From high above, we see the dark forest stretching out.
83a EXT. DARK FOREST - DAY 83a Snow White approaches a stream, kneels, splashes her face brings a handful of water to her lips.

I wouldn't do that if I were you. Not unless you want your bowels to rip apart. She turns. Eric has been snoozing on a rock, with one eye open. She releases the water, stands and faces off with E who offers his flask of mead. She reluctantly takes a sip spits most of it out, hands it back. He smells something, walks a few steps, bends down and ex a long brown pellet shaped object on the ground.
What is it?
A fumee.
83a CONTINUED: 83a
A what?
You want me to call it by another name? He doesn't need to. It's an animal dropping. Snow White w as he kneads it between his fingers and takes a long snif
45 83a CONTINUED: (2) 83a She catches the look of fear in his eyes as he gazes arou woods.
Stay here. He moves away, though the trees, tracking prey. He hears wind call his name...
Eric. He stops, looks to -- An outcropping of rocks, surrounded by dense forest. From out behind a tree steps an apparition of SARA. She's beautiful.
Sara?...
She hears him call out and follows his tracks.
Sara holds out her hand.
Am I dreaming?
Touch me and see for yourself. Eric shakes his head, looks around, tries to fight it, bu Her face draws him back and he begins to walk toward the rocks.

You weren't there to save me, Eric. I called for you but you never came. Snow White appears behind and sees -- Eric is walking toward a dark area where several sets of lupine eyes await. But Eric only sees Sara and he continues to move toward h She opens her arms to him and steps backwards, luring him
Where were you, Eric? Come to me now. Protect me now.
46 83a CONTINUED: (3) 83a

Sara, I'm so sorry. Forgive me, please forgive me. Give me peace. Sara... He takes another step toward her and -- Buckles - THWACK! Snow White hits him behind his knees with a piece of wood He hits the ground and she drags him away. He fights back she jumps on top of him, staring right into his face.

She's not real! Not real! Do you hear me?! He does and calms. She gets off him and he sits up, fatig by the experience. A low point for him. He reaches for his flask -- pours the last single drop in his mouth. All gone. He tosses it aside. A lost soul. Snow White watches him with some compassion. He catches h look, gets up and walks away. 83b EXT. DARK FOREST OPEN AREA - DAY 83b Snow White catches up.
Who is she? The one you bargained for. The one that spoke to you. Who is Sara?
A name you'll not mention again. He tosses a knife to her. She's surprised but catches it.
What?
Feel its weight. One hand to the other. She shakes her head but does so.
Now hold it - business end pointed at me.
Why are you?-- He lunges at her and she raises the blade.
Which is your lead foot?
83b CONTINUED: 83b
What do you mean?
47 83b CONTINUED: (2) 83b He jumps at her again and she puts her right foot forward knife in right hand pointed. He starts to slowly move tow her. One step at a time.
Now stay back. You're too small to attack. You have to parry; use your opponents strength against him. Raise your opposing forearm. She does. He comes closer.
With it you block and deflect an opposing thrust. You'll lose meat but you won't die from it. Wait until I'm close. He steps forward.
Not yet. Watch my hands, not my eyes. He moves even closer.
Not yet. Not until you can feel my breath. He moves right up to her.
Now. Their faces are inches apart.
This close. Drive it through me. To the hilt. Now look in my eyes.
Don't pull it out 'til you see my soul. Their eyes are still locked.
Why do I need to learn how to kill? He looks at her.
There's a lot you need to learn lass. Eric backs away.
Keep that. She nods, now-focused on him in a way other than as an instructor. He turns and walks away.
48 83b CONTINUED: (3) 83b
Where are you going?
Fumee.

A single blossom flowers on the dying apple tree. Ravenna looking weaker than before, stares at it quietly, as if s were gazing at Snow White. She reaches out and crushes th blossom in her hand, turning it into ash. Her look is one of conviction.
Find her.

Finn reacts as if he heard Ravenna's words. He did. They that kind of connection. Spooked, he continues on. The ot trackers follow, William looking tense. At the back of th group, one of the mercenaries slows down, sensing somethi the forest. William is still watching Finn when they hear a bloodcurd CRY behind them. The mercenary's horse gallops out of the without its rider, a gaping wound in its side. William an others look shaken but Finn doesn't even turn around, rid 87a EXT. DARK FOREST - DAY. 87a Eric pulls Snow White along. Beyond a bridge we see open -- the bridge LEADS OUT OF THE DARK FOREST -- and birds circling on the distant horizon. Snow White looks relieved as she follows him down a slope They hurry through a sea of mist when suddenly Eric stops
What is it?
It can't be this easy. He quietly unsheathes a hatchet.
Is this the end of the Dark Forest?
(not paying attention) Uh-huh.
49 87a CONTINUED: 87a

How far to the Duke's castle? He ignores, follows tracks, then stops as he sees the STO BRIDGE below -- LEADING OUT OF THE DARK FOREST. Snow Whit stares at it too, relieved. Beyond the bridge there are o fens. They hurry down together and start to cross the bridge. They're half way across WHEN SUDDENLY WE SEE THE STONES S

head_text.subj: A PAIR OF EYES OPENS IN THE STONE, AND SLOWLY THE BRIDGE

text: Snow White turns to see -- A HUGE CREATURE REARING UP --

head_text.subj: TWENTY FEET TALL. IT'S NOT A BRIDGE AT ALL BUT A --

text: Troll! Eric and Snow White are SLAMMED off the bridge and land i the shallow creek below -- among the CARCASSES OF SLAIN ANIMALS. The troll roars and comes after them, swinging i giant stone fists. Eric grabs Snow White and runs -- As the troll catches up with them, Eric shoves her out of way and draws his hatchets.

Run! Snow White turns and flees. Eric runs at the Troll. He du as a mighty arm sweeps over him, darts between the troll' legs, and hacks at its leg with his hatchets. The Troll falters a bit then -- A swinging stone fist catches him and hurls him across th creek. Snow White looks back to see Eric lying stunned on the ground, his wound bleeding again, at the troll's mercy. S hesitates, still terrified, then runs back. The Troll towers over the huntsman. It raises its stone h to crush him when -- Snow White arrives -- SCREAMING LIKE A BANSHEE! The Troll looks around in surprise. So does Eric. A beat, then the monster turns away from Eric, striding towards S
She stands her ground, fighting her terror, PULLS HER KNI The TROLL looms over her, but she doesn't retreat. She ra an arm, just as Eric instructed.
87a CONTINUED: (2) 87a Eric stares in surprise, watching the twenty foot monster towering over the tiny girl.

50 87a CONTINUED: (3) 87a Snow White stares into the troll's eyes, seeing something almost gentle in its monstrous gaze, slowly losing her fe The troll stares at her too, confused, then slowly pacifi until it finally turns and strides away. Eric stares in disbelief. Snow White is rooted to the spo also confused but strangely moved by what's happened. Eri rises to his feet painfully and heads over, taking her by arm.
I told you to run.
If I had you'd be dead. A "thank you" would suffice. It's clear he sees her in a different light. She stares b at him. Eric holds her gaze, struggling a bit, then...
Thank you.

The sun glints through the thinning trees. Eric wades thr the deep sludge, Snow White following in his steps. Eric looks at her a moment, then suddenly turns away as h sees her expression change -- GHOSTLY BACKLIT FIGURES EMERGE on the banks of the marsh holding bows and arrows. Eric looks around for an escape but everywhere he turns MORE FIGURES APPEAR. He draws his axe when A FIGURE IN A HOODED CLOAK (ANNA) a clutching her bow like a goddess.
They say only demons or spirits can survive the dark forest. Which are you? Eric, unsure, pulls his hatchet and steps in front of Sno White protecting her.
Which are you?
Neither. Perhaps you are the Queen's spies?
We're fugitives from the Queen. Snow White steps forward into the light.
We mean you no harm.
Anna sees Snow White clearly now, raises her hood. Snow White sees a deep scar running down her otherwise beautif face. And then a smile.
The fenland village is made up of mud huts, elevated on s to protect them from flooding.
Where are the men?
Gone. Anna paddles a boat as they approach the village. Eric an Snow White speak quietly.

The boat stops and they get out. The women of the village move from their hut to greet them as they walk into the village. More women emerge from their huts to view the newcomers, men in sight. They all have scarred faces. All the women have assembled alongside the group, watchin with awe as they pass. They stare at Snow White and murmu They can't take their eyes off her. Some even reach out t touch her sleeve or dress.
(sotto; to Eric) Why are they looking at me like that?

I don't know, but keep smiling. A beautiful LITTLE GIRL, LILY, moves away from her friend and offers her hand. Snow White stops, looks down at the girl, trying not to stare at her scar. 90-93a OMITTED 90-93a 93b EXT. BANKS OF THE LAKE/ FENLAND VILLAGE - DAY. 93b Eric sits by the lake, ANNA bandaging his wounds.
You have travelled far Huntsman. With a heavy burden. Snow white is playing with Lily. They are making little d from straw.
I've had worse jobs. And anyway, she's not that heavy.
You mean... you do not know who she is? His eyes narrow.
What do you mean? He looks over.
52aA 93b CONTINUED: 93b
Who is she?
Snow White draws eyes upon the doll. Snow White's eyes fill with tears.
My father showed me how to make them. But he's gone away. Lily takes a stick and marks the dolls face with a scar..
Here. She's finished. She hands it to her.
93b CONTINUED: (2) 93b
She's beautiful. Lily smiles and runs off to play. Behind her Eric appears
These women... This place.. It's very peaceful. But it makes me very sad.
Why didn't you tell me? She stops. She knows.
Because I'd think it too fell a task? You'd be right. She looks at him. Shakes her head.
That's not why. It's because I've never said the words. She looks at Lily playing.

I'm not sure I believe it myself. I never felt like a.. (She stops.) Alone in a dark cell. For years. Fighting to cling to memories. What he looked like. Smelled like. The kind man with the big arms and the wonderful smiles.. To me.. he wasn't The King. He was my father. Eric doesn't know what to say. In time, he reaches in his pocket.
Here.
What is it?
I've carried it a long time.
What is it made of?
Gristle from a stag's heart. (off her look)
93b CONTINUED: (3) 93b
The stag's the most timid animal in the forest but there's a bone in it's heart that gives it courage in it's hour of need and makes it the bravest in of all God's creatures. It's a protection charm.
Or so they say. They share a look.
Was it hers? It's the most honest and emotional he's been with her.
Take it. She does.
Thank you, huntsman. He looks at the sky.
It's getting dark. He walks away.
53 93b CONTINUED: (4) 93b
Snow White lies in her bed. Nearby sleep Anna and Lily.
She's so beautiful.
That is not a kind thing to say in these times. Youth one cannot alter... beauty, however. We have sacrificed beauty to raise our children in peace. And you, your sacrifice will come, princess.
Snow White looks to Anna, surprised. a95 EXT. OUTSIDE THE HUT - SAME a95 Eric exits and pauses, looks back - through the flap can Snow White. He walks away. 54 95a OMITTED 95a
96a OMITTED 96a 96b INT. INSIDE THE HUT - SAME. 96b
You must prepare yourself, my dear. For a time soon comes when you must deliver that sacrifice. Will you be ready? Anna suddenly stops. As if something has disturbed her. S gets up and leaves.
What is it?

Sleep my dear. You must rest. She leaves. 96c EXT. FENLAND VILLAGE. NIGHT. 96c Eric makes his way along the perimeter, finding a path through the trees. Suddenly he stops. Turns. Twenty feet away. It's Anna.
How can you desert her now you know the truth?
Aye I know the truth. And that's exactly why she should be as far from me as possible.
She's the only one that can save us. She needs you.
Trust me. I'm the last thing she needs. I'm bad luck. Everything I've ever cared about was destroyed.
There's good in you Huntsman. I can see it.
People have made that mistake before. He heads off into the night.
97a OMITTED 97a

Snow White awakens. Looks around, no Eric, puts it in her pocket. Then smells smoke, walks outside and looks up to The sky BLAZES WITH BURNING ARROWS all raining down on th village. 104a EXT. WOODS - SAME - NIGHT. 104a Eric, moving away from the village, spins to see the ARRO LIGHTING UP THE SKY BEHIND HIM. He races toward the villa 104b-107 OMITTED 104b-107

Snow White re-enters the hut just as A FLAMING ARROW pier through the thatch and sticks next to Lily's sleeping hea Snow White pushes Lily away from the fire and grabs the arrow. Anna SCREAMS because - A MERCENARY races into the hut. On impulse Snow White backhand STABS HIM in the leg WITH FLAMING ARROW and he tumbles, flames burning his clothes. Snow White stares at him for a moment, his face, his pain Anna shakes her out of the moment and they all race out.
Finn and his hunters scour the inferno on their horses.
Run, rats, run. Find her! William looks around the burning village in panic.
llla OMITTED llla
Snow White runs with Lily and Anna when she sees a FEARSO MERCENARY leap off his horse and stride towards them.

Run! Snow White faces off with the Mercenary. She does as she' taught - waits for him to approach. When he's close enoug grab her slashes at him with the knife. The huge mercenar knocks her to the ground and advances on her. -- when an arrow strikes him in the shoulder. He falls, revealing a young warrior holding a bow. It's WILLIAM. Snow White stares at him through the flames a mixture of recognition and uncertainty. It's as if for a moment everything stops as she comes
With something from the past. Almost like a ghost. Or a vision.. He nods to her in recognition. She stands perfectly still.
Anna pulls Snow White away, as they move through the smok and the fire. William starts to follow, a curtain of smoke swirling aro him.

Eric arrives to see the village in flames. He rushes to t centre of the village, pulling a mercenary off his horse running him through with his own sword, then fighting and killing TWO MORE MERCS as he makes his way forward. 55aA
Finn sits astride his horse like a demon king in the fire He spots William in the distance, searching for Snow Whit rides toward him.
Snow White looks back through the distant flames as she r when suddenly powerful arms grab her. She flails with the but it's only Eric --
Come on!
We must help them! Anna sees Snow White fighting off Eric and shouts --
You will! Go! Eric holds her firmly, pulling her away against her will.
William jumps on his horse again, looking for Snow White the clouds of billowing smoke. Finn and Aldan ride up.
Have you seen her?
No, my lord. Finn spits fury and continues to race around, frantic.

Eric pulls Snow White onwards, the blazing fires from the village lighting up the marsh. He sees a lake up ahead wh figure appears, blocking their way. It's the giant BROCH. Grinning, he unstraps his huge axe, ready to face Eric on time. Eric doesn't even slow down, letting go of Snow Whi unstrapping his own hatchets. It looks as if it's going t epic fight, but as Broch swings, Eric ducks and drives bo hatchets into the giant's ribs, killing him instantly. They escape into the darkness.
Ravenna walks up the spiral staircase. She passes an old woman who glances at her. She walks past a few steps, thi she hears a whisper, then turns on a heel.
What did you say? Then she's right in her face --
The "old woman" just stares at her, shakes her head. Ther something in the woman's eyes that terrifies Ravenna. She backs up, retreating, then scurries away.

Ravenna sits alone, naked. Her spine stretches through he taut skin.  In front of her sits the CROWN on a dark cushion, a matte tuft of HAIR caught on the gilded edge. She stares at it, then slowly raises her hand to a bald patch at the side o her hair.
The word echoes in the palace --
Finn, surrounded by smoke and fire, is beyond frustration He screams to the heavens in despair.
Eric and Snow White are far down river. They make their w the bank, drenched and exhausted. Snow White's hands shak distraught over the violence at the village. Eric looks a guiltily.
Why did you come back?
I led them there. I am to blame. Snow White looks at him with empathy. He's in pain, too.

I will take you to Duke Hammond's. Snow White slowly nods. Eric lies back and looks up at the sun flickering through trees. It dances on his face and then -- A HUGE SHADOW blots out the light. Before he can react, fists and boots lay into him. As he protects his face, we catch glimpses of brutal figures in battle masks. Eric kicks a couple of them away, but more them swarm over him, pinning him down in leg locks and ch holds. Snow White is treated just as roughly, powerful arms and pinning her down. She bites one of her captors and he twi her arms behind her back. A noose is slung around Eric's ankles and he's hauled up - hanging upside down. Snow Whi also tied up, sits on the ground beside him. A line of DWARVES stand before them and pull up their grotesque BATTLE MASKS. The dwarf leader, Beith glowers.
Well, well, well... the miscreant huntsman.
Come on, Beith! Is this how you treat a friend? The dwarf leader, BEITH, glowers.
No, you horn beast, this is how I treat a friend! He smacks Eric with a gnarled stick.

124a EXT. WOODS - LATER - DAY. 124a Snow White and the huntsman are still trussed up like chi now. The dwarves are grouped together, arguing and occasi throwing angry glances toward Eric. As they bicker the dw slap and bite at each other - like animals.
59 124a CONTINUED: 124a
What did you do to them?
I tried to collect the bounty on their heads. A few times.
Is there no one you haven't wronged? Eric nods at her. "You."
But there's always tomorrow.
Shut it, you hedge pig. The Dwarf confab breaks up and they approach.
This is my lucky day, the puttock I loathe most in the world lands in my lap.
It is your lucky day, Beith. I've got enough gold to keep you in ale for a year. Cut me down and I'll -- NION, Beith's right hand man and a fervent dwarf supremac clips Eric around the ear.
Shut your ugly mug, huntsman. You had any pennies they would have fallen out your pockets by now.
It's hidden. Back there, in the woods. A short distance. They get the reference, don't like it. Nion slaps Eric ag
Pull the other one, you lying dangler.
Tell them the truth, huntsman. The youngest of the dwarves, GUS, is beaming at Snow Whit his dirty teeth.
What are you looking at?
124a CONTINUED: (2) 124a

Nothing, Miss. It's just... you been the prettiest thing I ever did seen. He smiles, almost sweetly, disarming her. Snow White look her other captors now, noticing a blind dwarf, (MUIR), wh with his son (QUERT), also gazing at her.
60 124a CONTINUED: (3) 124a
Just tell me what I've done wrong?
Tell me what you've done right first?
I saved this girl from the Queen. Out of the goodness of my heart. Snow White gives him a look. He calms her with a look of own.
Doesn't sound like you, huntsman.
People change.
People, not ruttish swine. Nion gives Eric another smack around the head.

Quert? Quert jumps to and helps his father as he makes his way t Snow White. He touches her face and something happens in him. His demeanor softens and the hint of a smile lands o his lips. Meanwhile...
So what's the verdict?
Leave 'em to rot.
Yeah. Or skewer him and leave her to rot!
That would work, too, but my way's cleaner. Note: Coll and Duir have this "at each other but we're comrades" relationship. Coll also has an incessant cough.
No! (a beat for emphasis) She is destined. They all trade looks. Muir is the spiritual leader of the group and they dare not speak against him, even Beith.
Destined?...
61 124a CONTINUED: (4) 124a
She is.
Are you?
Do you hate the Queen?
Hate's a strong word.
But not strong enough in this case.
My father was King Magnus. This carries weight with the group. Impressed.
No one listens to me.
If you accompany us to the Duke's castle you will be paid handsomely.
We don't need their help.
You were already lost seeing that you found us.
How handsomely?
Your weight in gold. Each of you. The dwarves trade glances, literally sizing each other up
That's more than you offered me?!
Goodness of your heart, eh, Huntsman?
(whispers to Coll) I get more than you.
True, but because of your size you eat and drink more, which costs more, so...
62 124a CONTINUED: (5) 124a
Alright, we'll take you, but the huntsman can hang -
Both of us. Eric looks surprised by her loyalty. So do the dwarves. Suddenly Duir calls out:
Riders! The dwarves look round to see a DOZEN SILHOUETTED HORSEME appear on the crest of a DISTANT HILL.
Those are the Queen's men, Beith, better decide quickly.
One dwarf's worth a dozen tallsters, I'll take my time thank you -- He suddenly stops as dozens more RIDERS appear on the hil
You were saying?
Cut him down! MOVE OUT! Nion roughly cuts the line and the Huntsman drops to the ground as Gus gently lifts Snow White. They all hurry dow the hill.
The dwarves and their captives arrive at a rocky outcrop. and Coll pull back a large root exposing a cave entrance.
Ah, a short cut. All 8 dwarf heads spin at him - pissed off. Enough with t short jokes. Nion raps Eric's knee with the flat of his dagger.
Owww!!! Gus cuts Snow White loose.
Nion hesitates, then reluctantly frees the huntsman. DUIR COLL lead the way into a cave. Gus pulls Snow White to sa just as the enemy riders appear.

From their hidden vantage point, Eric, Snow White, and th dwarves watch the riders searching for them. Some gallop a small troop remain behind. Realizing they have no choic to retreat further, Duir and Coll signal and the dwarves them deeper into the cave system. 63
A shaft of light pours through the cave roof high above, circling. The dwarves move effortlessly down the labyrint Snow White and the huntsman have to squeeze through the c

Snow White and the huntsman emerge from the cave to see a shimmering landscape of glistening moss and sunlight. It' a mirage. The air is filled with specks of pollen and a s HUMMING NOISE echoes like music. For Snow White, it's the beautiful sound she's ever heard. Next to her, Nion, snor
Blasted fairy music. Wish I had some wax to stuff my ears.
There's plenty of moss. GORT scoops up a handful of moss and moulds himself some plugs, sticking them in his ears. Snow White is still mes by the fairy music and the shimmering haze.
What is this place? The huntsman looks just as dazzled.

They call it Sanctuary, my lady. The Enchanted Forest. It's the home of the fairies. And slowly the hazy curtain gives way to an enchanted for as different to the dark forest as one could imagine -- Life grows everywhere -- LUSH GRASS, PROUD TREES COVERED

head_text.subj: BUTTERFLIES, BUBBLING STREAMS, MOSS COVERED TORTOISES, FO
RABBITS SIDE BY SIDE, EXOTIC FLOWERS AND EVERYWHERE THE L

text: Snow White sees tiny figures flying behind the trees -- a too fast to spot -- the pollen following them in long tra
Fairies.
Pests. Of the other dwarves, only the blind MUIR seems to apprec the beauty around him, enjoying the vibrations on his fac
set up camp. 64

HEARTY, SOULFUL SINGING. Seated among the ruins, the dwar sing a Celtic ballad as old as time, GUS playing the fidd Coll and Duir sit away from the others, gazing out with t thousand yard stare of hardened war veterans.
That song takes me back to the battle of Tylweth Gate. A small horde versus an army. Pickaxes against swords and spears.
Them were the days.
What happened to your quailing cough? Coll shakes his head, "dunno". The two of them smile then in the singing. A drunken GORT takes a swig of ale and st over to GUS.

Play louder, you whey-face, I can still hear those harpy fairies. He takes another swig and sings at the top of his voice, tune, trying to drown out the humming of the unseen fairi Snow White and the huntsman look on, smiling.
Legend has it dwarves were created to uncover all the riches hidden on earth. Not just gold and precious stones, but the beauty in people's hearts.
Really?

Ask me, they've lost the art if they ever had it. When the Queen seized their mines she stole their treasure but more than that she stole their pride. And as if to prove it, GORT and NION sing and share from of rum before they tumble to the ground-near Muir as the ends. Eric notices the tumble and chuckles.
What are you pribbling at, longshanks?!
Nothing half-wit.
I'm half of nothing.you canker blossom.
Son?... Sing the one. Perched on his stone, QUERT nods; sings a more CHEERFUL S Eric watches as Snow White walks over to Muir. Before she say anything...
That seat's not taken, if that's what you were about to ask. She sits on the log beside him. Gort and Nion eye her.
Thank you so much, sir.
It's only a log, no need to praise me.
No. For before. For defending me.
Your father was a good man. The kingdom prospered. Our people prospered.
There were more of you?
Aye. And that is all Muir will say on the subject. Gort fills

One day the group you see before you went down into the mine for a month long shift. Gus was only a boy. When we came back to the surface... nothing. The land was black, everything, everyone... dead, gone. We searched but... Gort surprises himself by choking up a bit. Muir helps ou
That was the month your father died.
I'm so sorry.
As am I, princess. As am I. GUS walks over to Snow White.
I know I'm a bit spongy to look at, Miss, but would you care to dance-with a little 'un?
I'd be honored. Snow White gets up and dances with Gus as the song picks
Nion and Gort watch her dance with Gus. Nion's not impressed, leans in to Gort...
I don't trust her. And I don't believe in her, no matter what Muir says. Gort is still melancholy...
Just you and me,... do you think there are any of us left? Do you think perhaps they were merely banished?
As long as the Queen's in charge we'll never know.
Well, maybe that's the point, isn't it? (beat; out of the blue) I feel funny. Queer almost.
Queer. Since when?
How's your gout? Nion rubs his leg.
Better. Gort's look goes from Nion to Snow White.
You don't think it has anything to do with...
How much have you had to drink?! The huntsman drains the last few drops of his rum when BE approaches, sitting beside him gruffly.
Fleecing us of all our rum, eh huntsman?
