What do you say, we let bygones be bygones?
Not yet, nut-hook. What's in it for you? (off Eric's innocent expression) I'm talking about the girl? Is it really just the gold?
Eric watches Snow White dancing with Gus, then shrugs.
I'm not sure, Beith. If I had any sense I'd have abandoned her long ago. Beith eyes Eric as he watches Snow White dance.
Muir says she's destined. Question is, huntsman, for whom? Gus and Snow White are still dancing.
(As Snow White treads on his toes) You don't mind me saying, you got two left feet for a princess.
I don't mind at all, Gus. I haven't danced in a long, long while. She feels eyes on her - turns to see the huntsman watchin with a slight smile. She smiles back and breaks away.
Do you mind, Gus?
Not at all. Snow White walks over to the Huntsman, holds out her hand
You've taught me to fight, surely I can teach you to dance. Eric trades a look with Beith, who nudges him on. Eric stands and they proceed to dance, with her teaching.
Palms up, head straight, look me in the eyes. And... The huntsman moves better than you'd imagine. His face ev softens as they both enjoy the dance. Beith looks on with a smile. 130a OMITTED 130a
Eric and the dwarves are asleep. Flowers have grown aroun as if they've been asleep for months. Cull and Duir sleep sitting up, back to back, at the read

Muir, also awake and smiling, sits against the log, his h rubbing his son's sleeping head. Snow White sits amazed, drinking in the sights and sounds Animals emerge from the forest -- SQUIRRELS, BEAVERS, FOX BIRDS. Slowly they make their way towards the ruins, gazi Snow White. THE NIGHT SHIMMERS WITH FAIRY LIGHT AS THEY OBSERVE HER. Snow White feels the light on her face and to her surpris sees the two MAGPIES who watched over her at the castle. BEAUTIFUL FAIRIES WITH THE DEER EYES slip out of the magp bodies, beaming at her. As Snow White sits up, they direct her to the woods WHERE DAZZLING LIGHT SHINES THROUGH A TREE. As she walks animal in alongside her. A little way away, Gus snores in his sleep. The golden li crosses his face and he wakes up. As he opens his eyes, h stares in wonder, then quickly wakes the other dwarves. They all stare in amazement now, even the blind MUIR. Eri the last to wake up, wondering what the fuss is all about They rise and follow to --
She stands BENEATH THE GIANT TREE, facing a MAJESTIC WHIT The air around the mystical creature shimmers with a gold light.
No one's ever seen it before. The excited Muir grabs his son Quert by the arm.
The white hart bows before the princess, father. Sure enough, the HART lowers its head before Snow White. face is lit up in the golden light, his blind eyes shinin
It's blessing her.
What are you talking about?
You have eyes, huntsman, but do not see. You who have been with her the longest. Eric doesn't understand.
She is life itself. She will heal the land. She is the one.
So you're saying she is destined?... Muir can only shake his head.
No one listens to me.
Can't you feel it? Are you ailments not gone? Gold or no gold, where she leads I follow.
Aye! The other Dwarves trade looks. Nion, the last, shrugs. As Snow White strokes the hart's neck, the golden light brightens, engulfing her.

head_text.subj: -- SUDDENLY AN ARROW FLIES THROUGH THE AIR

text: The HART roars in pain and bolts. The fairies and animals scatter in all directions now, their sanctuary violated. Eric looks up to see ALDAN the Yakut emerging through the on horseback, notching another arrow to his bow. A FIERCE WIND rips through the sanctuary now, shadows spr where there was once light. Eric sees FINN appear on hors looking like a demon god in the gathering darkness. The huntsman grabs his axe. So do the dwarves, pulling on battle masks. WILLIAM emerges through the trees to see ALDAN aiming his Snow White. He rides into the Yakut's horse, knocking him balance just as he fires -- The arrow narrowly misses Snow White, thudding into a tre grabs her by the hand.

Come on! He runs with her into the forest. Aldan turns on William furiously, drawing his curved swor before he can swing the dwarves attack both men -- Eric only has eyes for Finn. They stare at each other in roaring wind, then Finn gallops into the forest after-Sno Eric RUNS in the same direction --
William fends off the furious dwarf attack then rides off pursuit of snow white -- Aldan sees him but is too busy defending himself against and DUIR to give chase --
All around the forest the shadow of death is spreading. G runs, dragging Snow White behind him. Galloping through t trees, WILLIAM spots them up ahead, riding faster.

location: ANOTHER PART OF THE ENCHANTED FOREST

text: Bow and arrow at the ready, Eric runs after Finn. All aro the forest is darkening. He follows the sound of gallopin hooves when suddenly they stop. He stops too, notching an to his bow, peering into the gloom and listening. There's a tense silence, then SUDDENLY HE HEARS A NOISE. spins around, ready to fire, when he sees it's only Finn' riderless horse galloping past -- He realizes too late that it's a trick -- FINN EXPLODES O THE DARKNESS, catching him a glancing blow with his sword
Coll and Duir leap up at Aldan, trying to drag him off hi horse, but he's a ferocious fighter, driving them both ba
William spots Snow White up ahead. She disappears into th trees and he rides faster. She erupts from behind a branc pulls him off his horse. Gus races over and raises his ax
Gus, no! Gus's axe stops inches from William's eyes. Snow White recognizes the young warrior, staring at him in surprise.
I saw you at the village. William looks up at her, out of breath:

It's me. William. Snow White stares in disbelief, tears of surprise welling eyes. Gus looks even more confused, lowering his axe. William slowly rises to his feet, gazing back at Snow Whi when THEY HEAR A TWIG SNAP -- Gus hears it too, spinning around --
-- To see ALDAN with an arrow notched to his bow --

Gus launches himself -- and takes the arrow meant for Sno White. Before Aldan can load another arrow -- William fir arrow of his own, striking him in the chest. The Yakut to over, dead at last but still astride his horse. Snow White falls to her knees in anguish, cradling the dy Gus. He smiles weakly, holding her gaze, then whispers:
I shan't leave you, Miss.

location: ANOTHER PART OF THE ENCHANTED FOREST

text: Eric charges into Finn with a cry of rage. Finn deflects blow and hurls him back into the trees. Driven by fury, E charges again, but Finn uses his anger against him, ducki under the vicious blow and landing a brutal one of his ow Eric crashes into another tree. His eyes are still full o hatred but his body is weak. Finn smiles in contempt from yards away.
I captured many girls, but your wife was special.
What?!
She fought and then she begged. For her life. Please?!!! You should know she called for you. Your Sara.
How do you know her name?! Eric is shocked, desperate.
She told me. Just before I slit her throat.
Bastard... .- Eric notices a fallen TREE TRUNK behind Finn -- dead bran STICKING UP LIKE SPIKES. Finn steps toward him...
Now you can look for her in the other world and beg for her forgiveness.

Finn smiles and raises his sword for the death blow -- wh LUNGES. He throws himself at Finn, his momentum carrying both into THE DEAD TREE'S SPIKED BRANCHES -- The branches pierce Finn's body, their tips digging into flesh. Finn howls in agony --
Finn writhes, fighting to pull himself free of the branch Eric holds him down, even as the spikes dig into him, for Finn's wounds to stay open - unable to heal.
Sister -- heal me!! --
-- the SHADOWY ENERGY swirls around Finn's wounds -- but branches keep the wounds open, they cannot heal --

Ravenna sits at her desk - she is small and alone in the  vastness of the hall. She stares off into space, a quill in her hand - parchmen out before her. Then suddenly her body convulses - the bottle of black in spills - dark tendrils of liquid seep across the papers a the floor.
Finn ...no!  She falls to the floor - writhing.  She fights hard at first - but then begins to weaken - he power fades as she ages.  Then she stops.
Forgive me, brother.
Finn gasps as he feels Ravenna cut him off. Reacts in hor heartbreak as his wounds stop trying to heal.
Sister... Finn twitches for a moment, looks to Eric.
I feel... Then the light goes out of his eyes. He is finally dead. Slowly, Eric pulls himself free of the branches cutting i flesh.

She has broken their connection. We pull away from her.  Ravenna's head is down, depleted, forlorn. Completely sti Ink pools around her bony hands. But when she raises her We see conviction, hatred and determination.
You will pay. You will pay!!!

Still bleeding from his wounds, Eric hurries back through forest until he sees Snow White and the seven dwarves gat around Gus's body, chanting a low prayer. Eric stares in surprise, then notices William.
Who is this? Beith is about to reply when William answers for himself.
My name is William. I am Duke Hammond's son.
You look familiar. Eric dodges a bit with --
What is the Duke's son doing riding with the Queen's men?
I was looking for the princess.
Why?
To protect her.
The princess is well protected as you can see.
And who are you?
The man who got her this far your lordship.
I'm grateful for your help but I will take her from here.
You'll have to wait for your voice to break before you give me orders - William draws his sword in indignation and Eric draws his
Anyone can draw steel, boy. It takes a man to use it. William is about to react when Snow White turns...

Leave him, huntsman. He's our friend. He glares but his eyes glisten with tears. Snow White is still bowed over Gus's body, sobbing, mourning. The prayer chant ends. Nion spits with anger and walks aw
We need to convene. They all follow him a few steps away, where they have privacy.
What is it, Nion?

This is what happens when dwarves mix with men. We always come out worse. We have big hearts and we'll fight for any cause -- but for what? For some new Queen to call us runts and turn us out of our homes again?
I've nothing against the girl, but I'm not willing to risk my life for her either, like poor Gus. Beith considers quietly, the other dwarves listening too.
(whispers to Coll) Does this mean we're not fighting the Queen?
Not sure yet.
What about the gold he promised us?
What use is gold if you're dangling by your bony neck, you jackdaw?!
Aye, the Queen will flay us alive for helping her!
The White Hart blessed the girl. Nion shakes his head and rolls his eyes, but Beith listen
Even our own legends speak of the redeemer who will heal the land.
That little mutton?
All the lions and wolves in the kingdom have tried to defeat the Queen and failed. Why not a mutton? The dwarves stare at him incredulously.
Gus lost his life because of her!
No. He gave his life for her. As will I if necessary. Look at us. Look at what we've become. They trade looks. They know where he's going with this.

We were once proud, now we pilfer and drink and dream of when we didn't. I am willing to die for a chance at becoming the man I once was. And that is the last word. Quert puts his arm around his father and kisses his forehead. Beith and Gort trade a no and a smile.

QUERT sings a CELTIC MELODY OF LOSS as Gus is laid out on funeral pyre. All around him, THE BRIGHT COLORS OF THE ENCHANTED FOREST HAVE FADED and there are no animals and fairies to be seen. It's as if Ravenna's shadow has passe here too. The tough, battle hardened dwarves shed tears l children. Snow White looks heartbroken as Beith lights th pyre. As the flames rise, a HAUNTING LAMENT carries us in the next scene ---
Quert's SONG CONTINUES as the group make their way across barren hills and into the mountains --
William walks alongside Snow White, glancing at her tenta He waits until the others are out of earshot.
I'm sorry I left you. She looks over and sees the remorse in his eyes.
You didn't.
If I'd known you were alive I would have come sooner.

We were children, William. You're here now. They reach some steep rocks and Eric turns around, offeri White his hand. She takes it and he helps her up the slop William looks on, feeling jealous. Beith follows Duir and Coll up to the summit of the hill, looks at the surrounding peaks.

We'll rest the night at the top of this hill. 148a INT. MIRROR CHAMBER - ROYAL PALACE - DAY. 148a From above - Ravenna stands in the center of the room, surrounded by ravens. She raises her arms and they take flight, circling above her. She lowers her arms and their swirling pattern lowers, until she is completely surround by them - a tornado of ravens. She has become them, and they her.
A FIRE CRACKLES. The dwarves have set up camp. Coll and D sit on a rocky outcrop, Coll braiding Duir's hair while D sharpens his axe.
That's not how you sharpen an axe. You sharpen downward. Not upward..
My father taught me how to sharpen an axe.
Well he taught you wrong. He raises the axe, only half in jest.
You want to test it? William watches Snow White warming herself by the fire, t heads over to Eric, who is also keeping watch.
It's not my place to give you orders. I misjudged you. Eric looks up. He shakes William's hand.
And I you. William looks over to where Snow White is.
We shared a childhood together, before she was taken away. She hasn't changed. She has that same light inside her. Surely you can see it.. Eric looks at her.
You'd be blind not to.
If we can just get her to the castle, the people.. The people will see it. She's our only hope, Huntsman.
We'll get her to the castle. Don't worry about that..
I've thought about her constantly. Every time I closed my eyes. I can hardly believe I've found her.
You should tell her. She'd appreciate it.
I'm afraid to.
Not telling someone how you feel and living with the regret is a lot worse.

150a EXT. MOUNTAINS - DAWN. 150a Snow White sits on a rock, away from the camp, reflecting quietly. She stares out at the surrounding mountains and valleys w she suddenly senses a presence behind her. She turns in a -- but it's only William. William smiles back gently and whispers...
Walk with me. They walk into the silver birches.
Up here it's as if nothing's changed. The world looks beautiful again.
It will be. When you are Queen. Snow White turns, surprised by his words.
The people of this kingdom hate Ravenna with their very fiber.
It's strange, but... I feel only sorrow for her. William is taken aback by this but pushes on.
Once people find out you're alive they will rise up in your name. Snow White stares back at him uncertainly.
It takes more than a name. I an not my father, William.
You are his daughter. And rightful heir.
150a CONTINUED: 150a He steps closer, gazing into her eyes devotedly.
If I had a choice, I would take you far from here. And keep you safe by my side. But I have a duty. And so do you. They hold each other's gaze, Snow White still ridden with doubt.
79 150a CONTINUED: (2) 150a
How do I inspire? How do I lead men?

The same way you led me when we were children. I followed you everywhere. Ran when you called. I would have done anything for you. She looks touched by his words, smiling softly, trying to make light of them.
That's not how I remember it.
No?
No... They gaze into each other's eyes, close enough to kiss.

I remember we were always arguing. And fighting. And... She trails off, lost in his gaze. He stops, leans closer kisses her gently. They stay like that a moment, then Wil pulls away, holding something in his hand. Snow White smi as she sees that it's an APPLE. With a mischievous smile, William holds out the apple for Snow White, just like he did when they were children.
I remember this trick.

(With mock innocence) What trick? Snow White holds his gaze, then snatches the apple from h before he can take a bite, raising it to her lips with a smile. As she bites -- 150b OMITTED 150b 150c OMITTED 150c 150d EXT. CAMP SITE/ MOUNTAINS - DAWN. 150d. Eric, startled,- awakens. 80 150e EXT. MOUNTAINS - DAWN. 150e As Snow White chews, a flicker of a smile crosses William face. Snow White stares curiously, then suddenly gasps, struggling to breathe -- 150f EXT. CAMP SITE/ MOUNTAINS - DAWN. 150f Eric stands up, looks around, dwarves still asleep. He sh William, who wakes at the ready. They walk into the trees and follow -- A SINGLE SET OF TRACKS. 150g EXT. MOUNTAINS - DAWN. 150g Snow White staggers back and collapses in the snow, choki from poison. Her eyes water and her vision blurs. The fal William kneels beside her and slowly she sees Ravenna's features burning through, her cold blue eyes gleaming in
A SCREAM fills the air -- not Snow White but dozens of bi shrieking in the sky above --

Eric and William hear the panicked bird cries and run -- 158a EXT. SILVER BIRCH TREES/ MOUNTAINS - DAY. 158a Snow White's limbs are petrified, frost spreading across cheeks -- but her eyes are open, taking in everything. Ravenna leans over her, smiling.
You see, child, love always betrays us. A sigh escapes Snow White's lips, condensing into steam.

By fairest blood it was done and only by fairest blood can it be undone. You- were the only one who could break the-spell and end my life, and the only one pure enough to save me. She draws away, unwrapping her sacramental dagger.
You don't realize how lucky you are, never to know what it is to grow old.
81 158a CONTINUED: 158a She raises the knife, about to cut out Snow White's heart

head_text.subj: WHEN SUDDENLY HER BODY SHATTERS INTO A FLOCK OF SHRIEKING

text: And now we see the HUNTSMAN STANDING THERE, AXE IN HAND,

William blasts with a sword at the screeching birds -- Eric goes after her now, swinging his twin hatchets. The ravens scream and pluck at his eyes but he hacks at them fiercely, William joining in, until the shrieking birds finally take to the sky and vanish on the horizon. Eric and William rush to Snow White's side now. The dwarv arrive too, hurrying through the snow. William cradles Snow White in his arms, trying to revive but it's no use. Eric stares in dismay as he sees the poi drain the color from her lips. He kneels down and gazes a her. William turns to the dwarves.
What are you looking at? Help her! The dwarves stare back at him gravely but don't respond. desperate now, irrational --
You are dwarves, healers, save her! He grabs the blind seer, MUIR, shaking him.

Do something! Muir stares back at him with his empty eyes, tears gliste in them. William collapses in prayer, the light in Snow White's ey almost gone. Eric looks over, sees William's grief is as great as his own, and finally stops fighting. Snow White looks up at William as if she wants to say something, then the light in her eyes goes out. The dwarves are heartbroken. Eric looks dazed. William leans down and kisses Snow White gently on the li He pulls away,.hoping against hope. And then -- Nothing happens. She lies there, lifeless and white as th falling snow. On all the faces - realizing that she is truly gone.
158a CONTINUED: (2) 158a
What do we do?
82 158a CONTINUED: (3) 158a
What we promised.
A flock of ravens whips across the sky, swooping into --

The ravens burst into the mirror room and "crash" to the ground. Their swirl becomes -- Ravenna, on all fours, looking worse for wear, surrounded dead ravens. The effort depleted her. She GROWLS as she crawls toward the mirror.
What must I do?! Where is she?! Where have they taken her?! Answer me! The mirror just REFLECTS RAVENNA'S weary and aging face.
Nothing. Ravenna releases it all, looks up and quietly pleads...
help me...
"Help me?"...

There is nothing more pathetic than grovelling desperation. You sicken me, my Queen. The mirror starts to ripple, distorting Ravenna's face in something even more awful. 161a EXT. PLAINS NEAR CASTLE - DAY. 161a A wide shot as the group carries Snow White toward the castle.
Snow White's body is wrapped in a shroud, laid out on a funeral board. William leads it with tears in his eyes. E and the dwarves walk alongside the body, all lost in grie

162a INT. DUKE HAMMOND'S CASTLE - DAY. 162a Crowds move in to see and mourn the processional. Eric is careful to lower his eyes a bit to keep from being recognized. 162b INT. FUNERAL CHAMBER/ DUKE HAMMOND'S CASTLE - DAY. 1 Torchlight flickers. Snow White's body is laid out on a funeral bier, her face angelic in death. 63
Tent flaps open. William stands before Duke Hammond and h council of LORDS, arguing his case with fierce passion --
She died for us! For our cause! We cannot hide behind these walls and watch this land die with her!
Your grief clouds your judgement, my son.
My grief makes me see clearly, father. 163a INT. FUNERAL CHAMBER/ DUKE HAMMOND'S CASTLE - NIGHT. Eric steps from the shadows up to Snow White's body, flas hand. Drunk.
Here you are. Where it ends. Dressed Up to pretty. He takes another pull from the flask.

Like you're asleep; about to wake-up and give me more grief. Am I right? The he touches her arm. Feels the fabric of her funeral dress. Looks at her face and breaks a bit - losing the drunken swagger and speaking with her as if she was still alive.
You deserved better. And then he answers her...

She was my wife, princess. That was your question that went unanswered. Sara was her name. When I came back from the wars I carried with me the stench of death and the anger of the lost. I wasn't worth saving. But she did so anyway. I loved her more than anything or anyone. And then I let her out of my sight and she was gone and I became myself again. A self I never cared for. Until you. You remind me of her. Her spirit. Her heart. And now you, too, are gone. You both deserved better. And I'm sorry to have failed you as well.
163a CONTINUED: 163a Snow White lies pale and motionless on the bier. Eric rea down and gently brushes a strand of hair off her face.
You will be a Queen in heaven now... He leans down and kisses her lips.

And sit among the angels. He finally turns and leaves the chamber, tossing the flas aside, disgusted with himself. As we listen to his footsteps fade we hold on Snow White' beautiful face. For a long time she stays perfectly still
Her lips part ever so slightly, and she lets out an almos inaudible whisper of breath.
84 163a CONTINUED: (2) 163a Snow White's eyes open, gazing up at the ceiling, her thoughts far away. There's a strange calm about her now, quiet acceptance, as if she knows what she must do.
169a OMITTED 169a
Eric, carrying all his gear, eyes down, strides toward th gate and a clean getaway.
Open the gate.
Huntsman! Eric stops. He's been recognized. Percy catches up to him They share a look and Eric sighs.
Yes, I recognized you. Eric sighs.
We have no quarrel with you. Not anymore. You returned the princess to us. And for that... He hands over a heavy sack of gold. Eric takes it, weighs in his hand. God does he need it, but...
Keep your money.
He hands it back and turns for the now open gate. He exit the castle and as the doors begin to close -- SHOUTS OF JOY. Eric spins, wanders back to see what the commotion is all about.
170a OMITTED 170a
The council session continues. Duke Hammond stares at William gravely.

My duty is to protect the people who come to me for help. I will defend them with my last drop of blood but I will not abandon these walls. I cannot afford to believe in miracles. He suddenly stops as the SHOUTS outside the tent get loud He goes to the flap, opens it to see -- Snow White , still dressed in her white funeral robes, st at the top of the stairs that leads down into the courtya 171a EXT. COURTYARD - DUKE HAMMOND'S CASTLE 171a Everyone comes out of their tents and stands beneath Snow White. Her heart pounding, she makes her way down the stairs. All are riveted by the sight of her, as if they'r looking on an angel or a living miracle. Eric makes his way back into the courtyard and he, too, i stunned as he slides in next to the dwarves in the crowd.

It's a miracle! Duke Hammond, embarrassed and still stunned by the sight her, walks up the stairs to greet her. Several Generals follow him but stay a few steps below them. Hammond takes her by the hands as they speak.
Your highness... (He can't believe his eyes) We thought you...
No, my lord. William, below, stares at her in joy while his father sti looks dazed.
86 171a CONTINUED: 171a
You must rest -
I have rested long enough. Her voice is gentle but full of quiet conviction.
I am ready to ride by your side, my lord, when you face the Queen in battle. The Duke looks speechless for a moment.
There will be no battle, your highness. The best thing you can do for your people is stay safe behind these walls.
That is all I thought to do when I escaped. But I have come to learn there is no peace while others suffer. Have you not learned that?
The Queen cannot be defeated. She cannot be killed. And therefore there can be no victory. Snow White hesitates, her heart pounding, then replies:

I can vanquish her. Defeat her. I am the only one. She told me so herself. Duke Hammond starts to object, but Snow White's eyes and, her feet, lead her down the stairs to her people. When sh reaches the last step - now at their level - she speaks..

I have been told that I represent you, that it is my place to inspire you. That is wronct. I am not a Queen, not a leader, not a warrior. Absolute silence in the courtyard as people, lords, knigh hang on her every word.
You represent me, who I've become - your hopes,: your courage, your will - inspires me.
I have also been told my place is not to fight but to stay here, safely behind these walls. I will not.
171a CONTINUED: (2) 171a SNOW WHITE (cont'd) I hold life sacred, even more since I've tasted freedom, but I've lost my fear of death.
87 171a CONTINUED: (3) 171a Heads nod, people murmur approval. She has them in the pa of her hand.

If Ravenna comes for me, I will ride to meet her. And if she doesn't, I will ride to meet her. (looks back at Generals) Alone if I must. (back to people) But if you would join me, I will gladly give my life for you. For this land and its people have lost too much. Eric and the dwarves couldn't look prouder. Duke Hammond stares at her for a moment, then BOWS. A bea then William follows, then all the Lords and Knights. His eyes fixed on Snow White, Eric bows too. Then Beith. Then Muir and his son, Quert. Then Coll and Duir. And finally Gort and Nion. Snow White stands alone, overwhelmed by the faith of the kneeling warriors, and the responsibility on her shoulder 171b INT. MIRROR CHAMBER - ROYAL PALACE - NIGHT. 171b Ravenna raises her head to look into the mirror.

Yes, my Queen! Yes!!!! The Mirror Man laughs because Ravenna's face is younger, energy has returned and we see why when -- WE PULL BACK to reveal several CRONES, young only minutes before, now old and lying on the floor. Ravenna smiles, girding herself for the fight to come.

177a OMITTED 177a 177b EXT. CASTLE - NIGHT. 177b The army is amassed and ready to leave the gates. Snow Wh in full armor, sits astride a white horse, her coat of ch mail glittering in the torchlight. She looks like an ange bearing her fathers standard. Eric rides up next to her. She is happy to see him.
Back from the dead and instigating the masses.
So the Huntsman fights for something other than himself.
Only if you have need of a brutish soldier. She smiles, moved. He turns his horse to full back, but before he leaves...

You look fetching in mail. A bugle sounds and -- 88 177c EXT. CASTLE - NIGHT. 177c The Duke's army pours out of the great gate, their torche blazing in the night. From above, it looks like a river o lava coursing through the valley. Duke Hammond roars at t top of his. voice, urging his riders on, and now we see t vengeful fire spreading across the plain.

Ravenna and the general on the balcony. All around, soldi and Guards scurry to look busy lest they draw her wrath (though some can't help but notice her aging appearance. Ravenna sweeps away a map held out to her.
I don't need a map to see you've failed me, fool, your face is map enough!
Yes, my Queen.
Where are they now?
A half day's march away. Every hour their numbers grow. Rebels, peasants and deserters rally to them wherever they -
Deserters?
Yes, my Queen.
BLACK KNIGHT GENERAL (cont'd) They say the King's standard flies again. And now Ravenna understands -- Snow White.

Let them come. Let them break their hearts and skulls on these castle walls and bring my prize to me. You must not harm her. I need her heart -- still warm with blood. As she strides away. To soldiers --

Victory comes! 178a EXT. PLAINS - WIDE - DAWN. 178a Hammond's army thunders toward the castle. And then they arrive at -- 179 EXT. SAND DUNES OVERLOOKING RAVENNA'S CASTLE - DAWN. Horses crest the hill. And now, all around Snow White, we her army -- not just Duke Hammond's men -- but REBELS -- PEASANTS -- WOMEN -- all willing to follow her. Eric and William ride nearby. One of the Duke's commander arrives to brief him.
My lord, we only have a few hours before the tide comes in. Not long enough to breach the castle walls. We'll either be completely exposed or drowned by the ocean.
Is there any other way in? Tunnels? Caves?
No, my lord. Gloom descends on the gathering.
If we are at the portcullis when the sun clears the horizon it will be open. They all look at her.
But how?
An unmistakable brown sludge pours out of a sewage tunnel into the sea. It is the same sewers where Snow White esca We hear the sound of splashing oars and grumbling:
We look out at the faces of the dwarves, peering inside.
We're promised gold and volunteer for manure. How low has the dwarf race sunk?
Hi-Ho boys. Off to work. And they begin to crawl inside.
Ravenna stares out. On the distant cliffs she sees the ba of the rebel army. A ray of sunlight pours through the cl lighting up the tiny figure of Snow White.
Come to me.
Coll and Duir wade through the sewage, their axes held up front of them, not a flicker of emotion on their faces.
Seven dwarves against an army.
I like them odds. Behind them, Beith covers his nose from the stench, Gort Nion look like they're about to be sick, and Muir and his bring up the rear, the brown slime almost at Quert's mout

Times like this I wish I was taller. 183 EXT. SAND DUNES OVERLOOKING RAVENNA'S CASTLE - DAWN. Crashing waves break against the rocks, washing over the Duke Hammond stares at the RISING TIDE in concern.
We don't have much time.

Then we should ride now. They'll have the portcullis up by the time we arrive. Duke Hammond considers, then raises his sword. Snow white glances at the huntsman. He breaks rank and rides closer There's a tense silence, then the Duke BRINGS DOWN HIS SW his riders charge down the dunes.
Ravenna stares out confidently, her eyes still fixed on S White's distant banner.

The trap door in the courtyard rises and we see Beith's h up, his expert eyes scanning the courtyard until they spo portcullis. Ravenna's guards hurry past without seeing hi taking their positions on the battlements. Beith slips ba into the sewer.
The gatehouse is fifty yards away to left. Half a dozen guards and fifty armed soldiers. Archers on either side.
(Pulling out a huge knife) Give us a couple of minutes.
Four tops.
Snow White rides across the dunes. All around her, riders along the surf, waves crashing around them. Ravenna's cas comes into the view, the portcullis still down.
Coll and Duir move stealthily through the busy courtyard, small and fleet they're almost invisible.
Ravenna looks on as her archers take their positions and artillery men load missiles onto their trebuchets.

Snow White suddenly sees tiny dots of firelight on the ca walls. Eric realizes what they are and rides faster. The pinpoints of light soar up in the air, growing larger and brighter, until we realize they're FIERY MISSILES. Eric f Snow White's horse out of the way as a fireball explodes from her.
Fire rains down on the Duke's army now, panic spreading i ranks. Snow White takes her father's banner and holds it rallying the men and riding on.
Two unsuspecting guards collapse outside the gatehouse. B the other guards can react, Coll and Duir are on them, mo fast and hard, the assault over in seconds.
Beith sees Coll and Duir signal from outside the gatehous
Come on!

Waves crash over the rocks. Fireballs explode in the sand White sees men falling all around her, tears welling in h eyes, but she never falters. As William rides on, he sees castle walls through the smoke, the portcullis still down
The GUARDS in the gatehouse look over as the door splinte the dwarves come crashing through in their battle masks. though they're outnumbered, the seven fight like demons - the enemy are subdued.

On the castle walls, archers replace the trebuchets. Snow holds up her shield to protect herself from the sea of ar Up ahead, the portcullis is still down, Duke Hammond's fo circling back as they're trapped against the walls.
You must turn back!
I gave my word I would stand with them!
A huge pulley controls the portcullis. Beith, Gort and Ni their pickaxes while Coll and Duir tie up the guards.

Now let's see how this works! -- With a mighty blow of his axe, Beith shatters the chains up the pulley. The counter weights go flying down and the portcullis comes shooting up -- then suddenly stops -- JA 93
The Duke's army are still circling the gates, stones and pouring down on them from above. Arrows slam into Snow Wh shield but she still refuses to retreat.

Beith peers down at the jammed counter-weights in frustra when he hears a fierce cry. GORT jumps on the counter-wei trying to bring it down. Nion follows, yellingatthetopofh voice. Duir puffs up his proud chest and leapsontoo--
Snow White sees the portcullis shoot up now, the dwarves onto the counterweights for dear life. Smiling in relief, gallops through the open gates with Eric and William.
The Duke's riders charge into the courtyard. ARCHERS fire them from every corner of the castle, but they raise thei shields and leap off their horses, forming a defensive we
From her balcony above the portcullis, Ravenna watches he men being slaughtered; she enjoys the spectacle (Ravenna not care one bit about those men). Her eyes are locked on White.
Let her come to me...ALIVE! Ravenna's soldiers are merely there to hold Snow White's back. She has planned the whole thing, calculated every m

head_text.subj: TORTOISE FORMATION _ SNOW WHITE FIGHTS _ SNOW WHITE LOOKS
SNOW WHITE GOES THROUGH FIRE TO THE SIDE DOOR. -

text: Like a spider waiting in her web, with no concern about h soldiers' situation, Ravenna remains calm and calculated. Ravenna turns around and leaves the balcony to the throne room.
SNOW WHITE rushes into the castle. As soon as she passes door a dozen of Ravenna's men come outside closing the tr
Now Eric, William and their men have to fight the road bl In the courtyard, Ravenna's men are losing more and more Snow White's army will win.
Eric and William fight like demons, twice as fast, twice strong . They MUST pass.
206a OMITTED 206a 206b OMITTED 206b
Snow White storms into the throne room. She is breathing heavily, a mix of fear and determination.
The raven claw ring, taps, resonating through the halls. Ravenna stands at the top of the stairs, the mirror room  behind her.  Snow White approaches.
It ends today... I have come for YOU!
My rose has returned  (looking at Gus' small sword) .with a thorn! 207a OMITTED 207a
95 207a CONTINUED: 207a
209a INT. THRONE ROOM - DAY. 209a Eric, William and a dozen men rush in. Ravenna smiles, raises her hand.

I'll show you thorns! In a terrifying tremor, the black ceiling of the throne r starts to shatter into millions of shards.  Snow White turns back to see William, Eric and Hammond's the shards fall down like razor blades.  The men try to protect themselves. Some are caught out an skewered to the stone floor. Ravenna looks down at them i complete satisfaction.  The millions of black shards circle around Eric and his m completely blocking them and keeping them away from Snow White.

Come! ... Avenge your father, who was too weak to raise his sword. The millions of shards assemble themselves into three sev foot tall, razor sharp creatures. The DARK FAERIES: Raven ultimate soldiers. Snow White looks at Eric and William - unable to help her

96 209a CONTINUED: 209a Eric, William and the other men are completely surrounded these creatures; they move so fast. Eric tries to step aw from them... to no avail. One of the creatures rises in front of William. William tries to slash the creature. His sword goes through and the creature reforms itself ri away. The Dark Faerie opens it's mouth and screeches. William gets smashed aside, saved only by his shield. The Dark Faerie grabs the soldier right behind William and se him crashing into the wall.  Snow White walks up the stairs, torn and powerless. She looks at Eric one last time.  Eric looks back as he fights off a Dark Faerie with his t shields. He knows he does not have much time left but he ready to make the final sacrifice.

(battle cry!) Kill her! 209b INT. MIRROR CHAMBER - DAY. 209b Snow White braces herself and promptly follows Ravenna in the mirror room. Now Snow White is exactly where Ravenna wants her to be. The two women circle each other like heavyweight boxers.
Ten years you locked me away! Ravenna seems to relish this.

And every day, every hour led you to this ,moment. It burned inside you. It drove you forward, and here you are.. Listening only to her heart, Snow White lunges towards  Ravenna and tries - strikes at her with her sword. Ravenna steps aside and with very little effort - throws to the other side of the room.
That's it. Fight. Fight for your land... for your loss and for Hope!

209b CONTINUED: 209b Snow White slams and slides across the floor, she stops u the archway at the top of the stairs. She is dazed.  Ravenna treads on her back, then grabs her hair, pulls he head up to see William and his men being massacred.

Watch them die. You gave them hope and they believed you. You have lead them to their deaths. How foolish your followers. 97 209c INT. THRONE ROOM - SAME - DAY 209c Eric is trying to stay alive. He rams a Faerie into a pil Shredding the stone, the Faerie explodes in shards and reforms immediately behind Eric. Grabbing the first man in sight, the Faerie throws the po soldier to the other side of the room. on the opposite side another Faerie slides faster than th blink of an eye, grabs the man in flight extending it's cutting limbs and claws the soldier to his death. It is like carnage in slow motion. 209d OMITTED 209d 209e MOVED TO 209B 209e

William is being overrun by a school of shards. The shard shape up into a Faerie taking William up high. In a viole arm blow, the Faerie projects William onto the banquet ta six feet lower. The table shatters in splinters, William bouncing like a rag doll. Spinning around on it's way down, the Faerie skewers a soldier and impales another one into a pillar. The Faerie drags him ten feet up, tearing and digging deep into the stone column.

Enraged, Snow White jolts her body and frees herself from Ravenna's grasp. She swings her sword at Ravenna. She parries every attack with her bare hands. Snow White is breathless. One more strike... but Ravenna blocks it again, and this time she doesn't let go.

(face to face with Snow White) You were never ready for this princess! Snow White struggles to get out of her lock. Ravenna is t strong. Snow White's wrist is twisted. She holds her sword tight can't use it. Ravenna forces the twist. Her fragile bones crack.  Snow White screams in pain. The sword drops on the ground.
